for a child born on or after that commencement date*—5 days,

paragraph.continued: whether consecutive or not, for each confinement. (Replaced 30 of 2018 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (2)(a), the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: begins 4 weeks before the expected date of the delivery of the child; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ends 14 weeks beginning on the actual date of the delivery of the child. (Amended 13 of 2020 s. 8)

subsection.content: For subsection (2)(b), multiple births in one pregnancy are taken to be one confinement.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a miscarriage; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a child born before 27 February 2015. (Replaced 30 of 2018 s. 3)

section.name: s15F
section.heading: Notification requirements relating to paternity leave

subsection.leadIn: For section 15E(1)(c), an employee who intends to take paternity leave in respect of the birth of a child must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: notify the employer—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of his intention at least 3 months before the expected date of the delivery of the child; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: of the intended date of his leave before taking the leave; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if he does not notify the employer in accordance with paragraph (a)(i)) notify the employer of each intended date of his leave at least 5 days before that date.

subsection.leadIn: If the employer so requires, the employee must also give the employer a written statement signed by the employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the employee is the child’s father; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: stating—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of the child’s mother; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the expected date of the delivery, or (if the child has been born) the actual date of the delivery, of the child.

section.name: s15G
section.heading: Paternity leave not affected by other leave entitlements

subsection.content: Paternity leave is in addition to rest days, holidays and annual leave to which an employee is entitled under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee has, in compliance with the requirement in section 15F(1), notified the employer that he intends to take paternity leave on a particular day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that day falls on a rest day or holiday or falls within a period of annual leave,

subsection.continued: he is entitled to take the leave on the day immediately after the rest day, holiday or period of annual leave.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (2), the employee is entitled to take the leave on another day he chooses if he has notified the employer of his choice at least 2 days before that other day.
The employee is entitled to take leave on the day mentioned in subsection (2) even if that day falls on a day after the 14-week period mentioned in section 15E(3)(b). (Amended 13 of 2020 s. 9)
However, subsection (3) does not entitle the employee to take leave on a day that falls on a day outside the period specified in section 15E(3).

section.name: s15H
section.heading: Entitlement to paternity leave pay
section.leadIn: An employee is entitled to pay at the rate specified in section 15I in respect of each day on which he has taken paternity leave if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he has been employed under a continuous contract for a period of not less than 40 weeks immediately before that day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has complied with all the requirements in section 15J or 15K.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: SpecifiedDate
def.leadIn: specified date (指明日期), in relation to paternity leave taken by an employee, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the leave is taken in a period of consecutive days, the date on which that period begins; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the date on which the leave is taken;

def.name: Wages
def.leadIn: wages (工資), in subsections (2), (3) and (4), includes a sum of money paid by an employer in respect of any of the following days—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a day of paternity leave, a rest day, a sickness day, a holiday or a day of annual leave taken by the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a day of leave taken by the employee with the agreement of the employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a normal working day on which the employee is not provided with work by the employer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a day of absence from work of the employee due to temporary incapacity for which compensation is payable under section 10 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282).

subsection.leadIn: The daily rate of paternity leave pay is four-fifths of the employee’s average daily wages during—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 12 months immediately before the specified date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee has been employed by the employer for a period shorter than 12 months immediately before the specified date, the shorter period.

subsection.leadIn: The average daily wages are to be calculated without regard to—

def.name: ExcludedPeriod
def.leadIn: any period (excluded period) during the 12-month period or shorter period for which the employee was not paid wages or full wages because of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any paternity leave, rest day, sickness day, holiday or annual leave taken by the employee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any leave taken by the employee with the agreement of the employer;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the employee’s not being provided with work by the employer on a normal working day; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the employee’s absence from work due to temporary incapacity for which compensation is payable under section 10 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any wages paid to the employee for the excluded period.

subsection.def: To avoid doubt, if the amount of the wages paid to an employee in respect of a day covered by the definition of wages in subsection (1) is only a fraction of the amount earned by the employee on a normal working day, the employee’s average daily wages are to be calculated without regard to the wages and the day.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2), if for any reason it is impracticable to calculate an employee’s average daily wages in the manner provided in that subsection, the amount may be calculated by reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the wages earned by a person who was employed at the same work by the same employer during the period of 12 months immediately before the specified date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no such person, the wages earned by a person who was employed in the same trade or occupation and at the same work in the same district during the period of 12 months immediately before the specified date.

subsection.content: If, under the employee’s contract of employment or any other agreement or for any other reason, the employer pays a sum of money to the employee in respect of a day on which the employee takes paternity leave, the paternity leave pay payable to the employee in respect of the day under this Part is to be reduced by the sum.

section.name: s15J
section.heading: Documentary requirements relating to paternity leave pay: birth in Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: For section 15H(b), an employee who takes paternity leave in respect of the birth of a child in Hong Kong must provide the employer with the birth certificate of the child—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is issued under the Births and Deaths Registration Ordinance (Cap. 174); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on which the employee’s name is entered as the child’s father.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), if the child is born dead, or if the child dies after birth and no birth certificate has been issued in respect of the child under the Births and Deaths Registration Ordinance (Cap. 174), the employee must provide the employer with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a medical certificate described in subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: (if the employer so requires) a written statement signed by the employee, stating that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he is the father of the child delivered by the woman named in the medical certificate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the child is born dead or dies after birth (whichever is appropriate).

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (2)(a), the medical certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must certify the delivery of the child; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be issued by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a registered medical practitioner; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: despite section 16 of the Midwives Registration Ordinance (Cap. 162), a midwife registered under section 8, or deemed to be registered under section 25, of that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The documents required under this section must be provided to the employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 12 months after the first day on which the employee takes the paternity leave; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee has ceased to be employed by the employer, within the period mentioned in paragraph (a) or within 6 months after the cessation (whichever period expires first).

section.name: s15K
section.heading: Documentary requirements relating to paternity leave pay: birth outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: For section 15H(b), an employee who takes paternity leave in respect of the birth of a child in a place outside Hong Kong must provide the employer with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the birth certificate of the child—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.def: that is issued by the authorities of the place (authorities); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: on which the employee’s name is entered as the child’s father; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if the authorities do not issue birth certificates) any other document issued by the authorities that could reasonably be taken as proof that the employee is the child’s father.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), if the child is born dead or dies after birth, and neither the birth certificate nor document mentioned in that subsection is available, the employee must provide the employer with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a medical certificate or any other document issued by the authorities that could reasonably be taken as proof of the delivery of the child; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: (if the employer so requires) a written statement signed by the employee, stating that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he is the father of the child delivered by the woman named in the medical certificate or document; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the child is born dead or dies after birth (whichever is appropriate).

subsection.leadIn: The documents required under this section must be provided to the employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 12 months after the first day on which the employee takes the paternity leave; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee has ceased to be employed by the employer, within the period mentioned in paragraph (a) or within 6 months after the cessation (whichever period expires first).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: requisite document (所需文件), in relation to an employee who has taken paternity leave on a day, means the document required under section 15J or 15K for his entitlement to paternity leave pay in respect of the day.

def.name: LeaveDay
def.leadIn: If an employee has taken paternity leave on a day (leave day) and provided the employer with the requisite document on or before the leave day, the employer must pay him the paternity leave pay in respect of the leave day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not later than the day on which he is next paid his wages after the leave day; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he has ceased to be employed by the employer, not later than 7 days after the cessation.

subsection.leadIn: If the employee provides the employer with the requisite document after the leave day, the employer must pay him the paternity leave pay in respect of the leave day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not later than the day on which he is next paid his wages after the document is provided; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he has ceased to be employed by the employer, not later than 7 days after the document is provided.

subsection.leadIn: Where the employer has paid the employee the paternity leave pay in respect of the leave day before the requisite document is provided, the employer may deduct from his wages an amount equivalent to the paternity leave pay if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he fails to provide the employer with the requisite document within 3 months after the first day on which the paternity leave is taken; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he has ceased to be employed by the employer and fails to provide the employer with the requisite document before the cessation.

subsection.leadIn: If after the deduction the employee provides the employer with the requisite document in accordance with section 15J(4) or 15K(3), the employer must pay him the paternity leave pay in respect of the leave day again—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not later than the day on which he is next paid his wages after the document is provided; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he has ceased to be employed by the employer, not later than 7 days after the document is provided.

subsection.leadIn: An employer must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grant an employee paternity leave to which the employee is entitled; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pay an employee paternity leave pay to which the employee is entitled in accordance with section 15L.

subsection.content: An employer who without reasonable excuse contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Rest Days
part.sourceNote: (Part IV added 23 of 1970 s. 3. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2017)

subsection.content: Subject to the provisions of this Part, every employee who has been employed by the same employer under a continuous contract shall be granted not less than 1 rest day in every period of 7 days. (Amended 71 of 1976 s. 3)
Rest days shall be in addition to any statutory holiday, or alternative holiday or substituted holiday, to which an employee is entitled under section 39. (Replaced 39 of 1973 s. 3)
Rest days shall be appointed by an employer and he may appoint different rest days for different employees. (Amended 71 of 1976 s. 4)
Subject to subsection (4), every employer shall, before the commencement of every month, inform each employee orally or in writing of his rest days in that month.

The provisions of subsection (2) shall be deemed to be complied with if an employer exhibits in a conspicuous place in the place of employment and for so long as it applies a roster showing the days appointed to be rest days for each employee during the month.
Subsection (2) shall not apply where rest days are appointed on fixed days in each period of 7 days on a regular basis. (Amended 71 of 1976 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: An employer may, with the consent of his employee, substitute for any rest day appointed under this section some other rest day—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within the same month and before the rest day so appointed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within the period of 30 days next following the rest day so appointed.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), no employer shall require an employee to work on any of his rest days.
An employer may require an employee to work on his rest day if it is necessary to do so by reason of a breakdown of machinery or plant or other unforeseen emergency of any nature.

An employer shall substitute for any rest day on which an employee is required to work under subsection (2) some other rest day within the period of 30 days next following, notice of which shall be given to the employee within 48 hours after the employee is so required to work.
An employee may, at his own request and if the employer agrees, work for his employer on a rest day.
An employee may, at the request of his employer, work for his employer on a rest day.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Void conditions
section.content: Any condition in a contract of employment which makes the payment of any annual bonus, or any end of year payment or any proportion thereof, subject to working on rest days granted under this Part shall be void.

part.name: P4A
part.heading: Protection Against Anti-union Discrimination
part.sourceNote: (Part IVA added 51 of 1974 s. 3. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2017)

section.name: s21A
section.heading: Application of Part IVA
section.content: Section 21C shall apply to every person to whom an offer of employment is made or is about to be made or who otherwise is a prospective employee.

section.name: s21B
section.heading: Rights of employees in respect of trade union membership and activities

subsection.leadIn: Every employee shall as between himself and his employer have the following rights—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the right to associate with other persons for the purpose of forming or applying for the registration of a trade union in accordance with the provisions of the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332); (Amended 101 of 1997 s. 26)

subsection.leadIn: Any employer, or any person acting on behalf of an employer, who—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: terminates the contract of employment of, penalizes, or otherwise discriminates against, an employee by reason of his exercising any such right,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 6. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: AppropriateTime
def.leadIn: appropriate time (適當時間) means, in relation to an employee taking part in any activities of a trade union, time which either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is outside his working hours; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: working hours (工作時間) means, in relation to an employee, any time when, in accordance with his contract with his employer, he is required to be at work.

section.name: s21C
section.heading: Offer of employment conditional on offeree not being member of trade union
section.leadIn: Any person who, acting on his own or another’s behalf, in the engagement of persons for employment includes in an offer of employment to any person a condition or requirement that the person to whom the offer is made shall undertake—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if he is a member or officer of such a trade union, that he will relinquish his membership thereof or office therein;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not to become a member of, or officer in, such a trade union; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not to associate with other persons for the purpose of forming or applying for the registration of a trade union in accordance with the provisions of the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332),

section.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 6. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 s. 6)

part.name: P5
part.heading: Payment of Wages
part.sourceNote: (Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2017)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Wage period
section.content: The wage period in respect of which wages are payable under a contract of employment shall, until the contrary is proved, be deemed to be 1 month.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Time of payment of wages
section.content: Wages shall become due on the expiry of the last day of the wage period and shall be paid as soon as is practicable but in any case not later than 7 days thereafter.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Payment on completion
section.content: Wages of an employee on completion of his contract of employment and any other sum payable in respect of his contract shall be due to him on the day of the completion of the contract and shall be paid as soon as is practicable but in any case not later than 7 days thereafter.

subsection.content: Subject to section 31O, where a contract of employment is terminated any sum due to the employee shall be paid to him as soon as is practicable and in any case not later than 7 days after the day of termination. (Amended 44 of 1971 s. 4; 67 of 1974 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The sum referred to in subsection (1) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the equivalent of the amount earned by the employee for work done over the period commencing on the expiry of his wage period next preceding the time of termination up to that time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sum (if any) payable under sections 7, 15(2) and 33(4BA); (Amended 57 of 1983 s. 4; 76 of 1985 s. 3; 103 of 1995 s. 7; 7 of 2001 s. 6)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: any long service payment due to the employee; and (Added 76 of 1985 s. 3. Amended L.N. 34 of 1990)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other sum due to the employee in respect of his contract of employment.

subsection.content: In addition to any deduction which may be made under section 32, and subject to any order made by a court, an employer may deduct from any sum payable under subsection (1) to an employee who terminates his employment otherwise than under section 6, 7 or 10 such sum as the employee would have been liable to pay if he had terminated his employment under section 7. (Replaced 44 of 1971 s. 4. Amended 14 of 1975 s. 3; 48 of 1984 s. 12)

section.name: s25A
section.heading: Interest on late payment of wages

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), if any wages or any sum referred to in section 25(2)(a) are not paid within 7 days from the day on which they become due under sections 23, 24 and 25, the employer shall pay interest at the rate specified in subsection (2) on the outstanding amount of wages or sum from the date on which such wages or sum become due up to the date of actual payment.
The rate of interest specified for the purpose of subsection (1) shall be the rate fixed by the Chief Justice by notice in the Gazette under section 50 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).
No interest shall be payable in respect of any period before the commencement* of this section.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Manner and place of payment of wages

subsection.content: Subject to this Ordinance, wages shall be paid on a working day directly to an employee in legal tender at his place of employment or at any office or other place customarily used by the employer for the purpose of payment of wages or at any other place mutually agreed.

subsection.leadIn: With the consent of an employee wages may be paid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by cheque, money order or postal order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: into an account in his name with any bank within the meaning of section 2 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); or (Amended 49 of 1995 s. 53)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to his duly appointed agent.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Payment not to be made in certain places
section.leadIn: Wages, or any sum due to an employee in respect of his contract of employment on the completion or termination thereof, shall not be paid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in any place of amusement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any place where cash-sweeps, fixed odds betting or pari-mutuel betting is organized or conducted with the permission or authorization under the Betting Duty Ordinance (Cap. 108); (Amended 17 of 2006 s. 23)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any place where intoxicating liquor or any dangerous drug is sold; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in any shop or store for the retail sale of merchandise,

section.continued: except where the employee is employed in such place, shop or store.

subsection.content: A contract of employment may provide for giving to an employee food, accommodation or other allowances or privileges in addition to wages as remuneration for his services.

No employer shall give to an employee any intoxicating liquor, dangerous drug, or any ticket or other substitute for ticket for any cash-sweep, fixed odds betting or pari-mutuel betting organized or conducted with the permission or authorization under the Betting Duty Ordinance (Cap. 108) as remuneration for his services. (Amended 17 of 2006 s. 23)

section.name: s29
section.heading: Prohibition of agreements as to manner of spending
section.content: No employer shall in any contract of employment or agreement in consideration of a contract of employment make any provision as to the place at which, the manner in which, or the person with whom, wages paid to an employee are to be expended.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Provision of shops, etc. by employers for sale of commodities to employees
section.content: An employer may establish shops, stores or places for the sale of commodities to his employees, but no employer shall bind any employee by contract, agreement or other obligation, written or oral, express or implied, to make use of any such shop, store or place for the purchase of commodities.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Employer not to enter into contract of employment without reasonable belief that he can pay wages

subsection.content: No person shall enter into, renew or continue a contract of employment as an employer unless he believes upon reasonable grounds that he will be able to pay all wages due under the contract of employment as they become due.

An employer shall, if he ceases to believe upon reasonable grounds that he will be able to pay all the wages due by him under a contract of employment as they become due, forthwith take all necessary steps to terminate the contract in accordance with its terms.

part.name: P5A
part.heading: Severance Payments
part.sourceNote: (Part VA added 67 of 1974 s. 5. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2017)

section.name: s31B
section.heading: General provisions as to right to severance payment

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee who has been employed under a continuous contract for a period of not less than 24 months ending with the relevant date— (Amended 76 of 1985 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is dismissed by his employer by reason of redundancy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is laid off within the meaning of section 31E,

subsection.continued: the employer shall, subject to this Part and Part VC, be liable to pay to the employee a severance payment calculated in accordance with section 31G. (Amended 52 of 1988 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part an employee who is dismissed shall be taken to be dismissed by reason of redundancy if the dismissal is attributable wholly or mainly to the fact that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: his employer has ceased, or intends to cease, to carry on the business—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the purposes of which the employee was employed by him; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the place where the employee was so employed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements of that business for employees to carry out work of a particular kind, or for employees to carry out work of a particular kind in the place where the employee was so employed, have ceased or diminished or are expected to cease or diminish. (Replaced 62 of 1992 s. 4)

subsection.content: For the purposes of the application of this Part to an employee who is employed as a domestic servant in, or in connection with, a private household, this Part (except section 31J) shall apply as if the household were a business and the maintenance of the household were the carrying on of that business by the employer.

section.name: s31C
section.heading: General exclusions from right to severance payment by reason of dismissal

subsection.content: An employee shall not be entitled to a severance payment by reason of dismissal where his employer, being so entitled by reason of the employee’s conduct, terminates his contract of employment without notice or payment in lieu in accordance with section 9. (Amended 51 of 2000 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: An employee shall not be entitled to a severance payment by reason of dismissal if, not less than 7 days before the relevant date, the employer has offered to renew his contract of employment, or to re-engage him under a new contract, so that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisions of the contract as renewed, or of the new contract, as the case may be, as to the capacity and place in which he would be employed, and as to the other terms and conditions of his employment, would not differ from the corresponding provisions of the contract as in force immediately before his dismissal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the renewal or re-engagement would take effect on or before the relevant date,

subsection.continued: and the employee has unreasonably refused that offer.

subsection.leadIn: An employee shall not be entitled to a severance payment by reason of dismissal if, not less than 7 days before the relevant date, the employer has made to him an offer in writing to renew his contract of employment, or to re-engage him under a new contract, so that in accordance with the particulars specified in the offer the provisions of the contract as renewed, or of the new contract, as the case may be, as to the capacity and place in which he would be employed, and as to the other terms and conditions of his employment, would differ (wholly or in part) from the corresponding provisions of the contract as in force immediately before his dismissal, but—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offer constitutes an offer of suitable employment in relation to the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the offer constitutes an offer of employment no less favourable to the employee than hitherto; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the renewal or re-engagement would take effect on or before the relevant date,

subsection.continued: and the employee has unreasonably refused that offer.

subsection.content: Where the relevant date falls on a rest day or holiday, the references in subsection (2)(b) and subsection (3)(c) to the relevant date shall be construed as references to the next day after that rest day or holiday. (Amended 75 of 1997 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: An employee shall not be entitled to a severance payment by reason of dismissal where, having been given notice of the termination of his contract of employment by his employer in accordance with section 6, he leaves the service of his employer before the expiration of that notice unless he so leaves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with the prior consent of the employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after having made a payment in lieu to the employer in accordance with section 7. (Replaced 75 of 1997 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of and subject to this Part, an employee shall be taken to be dismissed by his employer if, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contract under which he is employed is terminated by the employer with or without notice or payment in lieu thereof other than in accordance with section 9;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where under that contract he is employed for a fixed term, that term expires without being renewed under the same contract; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the employee terminates that contract with or without notice or payment in lieu, in circumstances such that he is entitled to terminate it without notice or payment in lieu in accordance with section 10 by reason of the employer’s conduct. (Replaced 62 of 1992 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: An employee shall not be taken for the purposes of this Part to be dismissed by his employer if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his contract of employment is renewed, or he is re-engaged by the same employer under a new contract of employment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the renewal or re-engagement takes effect immediately on the ending of his employment under the previous contract.

subsection.content: For the purposes of the application of subsection (2) to a contract under which the employment ends on a rest day or holiday, the renewal or re-engagement shall be treated as taking effect immediately on the ending of the employment under the previous contract if it takes effect on or before the next day after that rest day or holiday.

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee is employed under a contract on such terms and conditions that his remuneration thereunder depends on his being provided by the employer with work of the kind he is employed to do, he shall for the purposes of section 31B(1) be taken to be laid off where the total number of days on each of which such work is not provided for him by the employer exceeds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: half of the total number of normal working days in any period of 4 consecutive weeks; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one-third of the total number of normal working days in any period of 26 consecutive weeks,

subsection.continued: and he is not paid a sum equivalent to the wages which he would have earned if work had been provided on the days on which no work was provided. (Amended 41 of 1990 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (1), any period during which an employee is not provided with work because of a lock-out by his employer, or as a result of a rest day, a statutory holiday or a day of annual leave, shall not be taken into account as normal working days in determining whether an employee has been laid off. (Added 41 of 1990 s. 8. Amended 61 of 1993 s. 4)
The continuity of a contract of employment of an employee shall not be treated as broken by any lay-off as a result of which no severance payment has been made.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this Part the relevant date (有關日期) in respect of the right of an employee to a severance payment arising by reason of lay-off means any day on which the period of 4 consecutive weeks or 26 consecutive weeks, as the case may be, referred to in subsection (1) has expired. (Amended 41 of 1990 s. 8)

section.name: s31F
section.heading: Excluded classes of employees
section.leadIn: Section 31B shall not apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the employer is the husband or wife of the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any outworker;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to any person, employed by a government other than the Hong Kong Government, who is a subject or citizen of the state under whose government he is employed; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: without prejudice to paragraph (a), to any person in respect of employment as a domestic servant in, or in connection with, a private household, where the employer is the father, mother, grandfather, grandmother, stepfather, stepmother, son, daughter, grandson, granddaughter, stepson, stepdaughter, brother, sister, half-brother or half-sister of the employee.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Part, the amount of a severance payment to which an employee is entitled shall be calculated by allowing— (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a monthly rated employee, two-thirds of his last full month’s wages, or two-thirds of $22,500, whichever is less; or (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, 18 days’ wages based on any 18 days chosen by the employee and occurring during his last 30 normal working days, or two-thirds of $22,500, whichever is less, (Amended L.N. 264 of 1995)

subsection.continued: for every year (and pro rata as respects an incomplete year) of employment under a continuous contract by his employer subject in all cases to a maximum payment not exceeding, where the relevant date occurs in a period specified in column 1 of Table A in the Seventh Schedule, the amount specified in column 2 of that table opposite to the period. (Amended 5 of 1995 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the employee may, for a calculation under that subsection, elect to have the employee’s wages averaged over the period of 12 months immediately preceding the relevant date as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a monthly rated employee—the amount specified under paragraph (a) of that subsection for the calculation were two-thirds of the employee’s average monthly wages during such a period, or two-thirds of $22,500, whichever is less; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the amount specified under paragraph (b) of that subsection for the calculation were 18 times the employee’s average daily wages during such a period. (Replaced 4 of 2022 s. 4)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: For calculating the average daily wages under subsection (2)(b), the total wages for the period of 12 months must not exceed 12 times $22,500. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 4)

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 2 of Schedule 11. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 4)

section.name: s31I
section.heading: Severance payment to be reduced by amount of gratuities and benefits in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee becomes entitled to payment of a severance payment under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.content: because of the operation of that contract, one or more employer-funded (specified) ORS benefits have been paid to the employee;
one or more employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefits are being held in one or more mandatory provident fund schemes in respect of the employee, or have been paid to or in respect of the employee.

subsection.content: The severance payment is to be reduced by the aggregate amount of every one of the gratuities and benefits referred to in subsection (1)(b) to the extent that it relates to the employee’s years of service for which the severance payment is payable.

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 3 of Schedule 11.

section.name: s31IA
section.heading: Gratuity or benefit to be reduced by amount of severance payment in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following conditions is met in relation to an employee—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employee has been paid a severance payment under this Part. (Replaced 4 of 2022 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The aggregate amount of every one of the gratuities and benefits referred to in subsection (1)(a) is to be reduced by the whole amount of the severance payment to the extent that it is attributable to the same years of service as those for which the severance payment is payable. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 6)
Subsection (1A) has effect even though the years of service for which the severance payment was made exceed those to which the gratuity or benefit is attributable. (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 6)

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 3 of Schedule 11. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: This section shall have effect where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a change occurs (whether by virtue of a sale or other disposition or by operation of law) in the ownership of a business for the purposes of which a person is employed, or of a part of such a business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in connection with that change the person by whom the employee is employed immediately before the change occurs (in this section referred to as the previous owner) terminates the employee’s contract in accordance with section 6 or 7.

subsection.content: If, by agreement with the employee, the person who immediately after the change occurs is the owner of the business or of the part of the business in question, as the case may be (in this section referred to as the new owner) renews the employee’s contract of employment (with the substitution of the new owner for the previous owner) or re-engages him under a new contract of employment, section 31D(2) shall have effect as if the renewal or re-engagement had been a renewal or re-engagement by the previous owner (without any substitution of the new owner for the previous owner).

If the new owner offers to renew the employee’s contract of employment (with the substitution of the new owner for the previous owner) or to re-engage him under a new contract of employment, but the employee refuses the offer, section 31C(2) or (3) (as the case may be) shall have effect, subject to subsection (4), in relation to that offer and refusal as it would have had effect in relation to the like offer made by the previous owner and a refusal of that offer by the employee.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the operation, in accordance with subsection (3), of section 31C(2) or (3) in relation to an offer made by the new owner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offer shall not be treated as one whereby the provisions of the contract as renewed, or of the new contract, as the case may be, would differ from the corresponding provisions of the contract as in force immediately before the dismissal by reason only that the new owner would be substituted for the previous owner as the employer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no account shall be taken of that substitution in determining whether the refusal of the offer was unreasonable.

subsection.leadIn: This section shall have effect (subject to the necessary modifications) in relation to a case where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person by whom a business, or part of a business, is owned immediately before a change is one of the persons by whom (whether as partners, trustees or otherwise) it is owned immediately after the change; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the persons by whom a business, or part of a business, is owned immediately before a change (whether as partners, trustees or otherwise) include the person or one or more of the persons by whom it is owned immediately after the change,

subsection.continued: as this section has effect where the previous owner and the new owner are wholly different persons.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall be construed as requiring any variation of a contract of employment by agreement between the parties to be treated as constituting a termination of the contract.

Where the employer is a company, any reference in this Part to re-engagement by the employer shall be construed as a reference to re-engagement by that company or by any associated company, and any reference in this Part to an offer made by the employer shall be construed as including a reference to an offer made by an associated company.

Subsection (1) shall not affect the operation of section 31J in a case where the previous owner and the new owner (as defined by that section) are associated companies; and where that section applies, subsection (1) shall not apply.

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee is dismissed by his employer, and the employer is a company (in this subsection referred to as the employing company) which has one or more associated companies, then if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: none of the conditions specified in section 31B(2) is fulfilled;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: one or other of those conditions would be fulfilled if the business of the employing company and the business of the associated company (or, if more than one, each of the associated companies) were treated as together constituting one business,

subsection.continued: that condition shall for the purposes of this Part be taken to be fulfilled in relation to the dismissal of the employee.

subsection.content: Where an employee of a company is taken into the employment of another company which, at the time when he is taken into its employment, is an associated company of the first-mentioned company, his period of employment at that time shall count as a period of employment with the associated company, and the change of employer shall not break the continuity of the period of employment.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section 2 companies shall be taken to be associated companies if one is a subsidiary of the other, or both are subsidiaries of a third company, and associated company (相聯公司) shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: company (公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
subsidiary (附屬公司) has the meaning given by section 15 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for the purposes of that Ordinance. (Replaced 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s31L
section.heading: Implied or constructive termination of contract

subsection.leadIn: Where in accordance with any enactment or rule of law—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any act on the part of the employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any event affecting an employer (including, in the case of an individual, his death),

subsection.continued: operates so as to terminate a contract under which an employee is employed by him, that act or event shall for the purposes of this Part be treated as a termination of the contract by the employer, if apart from this subsection it would not constitute a termination of the contract by him.

subsection.content: Where subsection (1) applies, and the employee’s contract of employment is not renewed, and he is not re-engaged under a new contract, as mentioned in section 31D(2), he shall for the purposes of this Part be taken to be dismissed by reason of redundancy if the circumstances in which the contract is not renewed and he is not re-engaged as mentioned in section 31D(2), are wholly or mainly attributable to one or other of the facts specified in section 31B(2).

For the purposes of subsection (2), section 31B(2)(a), in so far as it relates to the employer ceasing or intending to cease to carry on the business, shall be construed as if the reference to the employer included a reference to any person to whom, in consequence of the act or event in question, power to dispose of the business has passed.
In this section any reference to section 31D(2) includes a reference to section 31D(2) as applied by section 31J(2).

section.name: s31M
section.heading: Death of employer or of employee
section.content: Part I of the Third Schedule shall have effect in relation to the death of an employer; and Part II of that Schedule shall have effect in relation to the death of an employee.

section.name: s31N
section.heading: Claims for severance payments
section.leadIn: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, an employee shall not be entitled to a severance payment unless, before the end of the period of 3 months beginning with the relevant date, or within such extended period as the Commissioner may agree— (Amended 19 of 1984 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the payment has been agreed and paid;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employee has made a claim for payment by notice in writing given to the employer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a question as to the right of the employee to the payment, or as to the amount of the payment, has been made the subject of a claim filed with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board in accordance with Part 4 of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board Ordinance (Cap. 453); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Registrar of the Labour Tribunal in accordance with Part 4 of the Labour Tribunal Ordinance (Cap. 25). (Amended 61 of 1994 s. 50)

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee is entitled to a severance payment under this Part, his employer shall make the severance payment to him not later than 2 months from the receipt of a notice in accordance with paragraph (b) of section 31N unless either the employer or the employee has, before the expiration of that period, made the severance payment the subject of a claim filed with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board in accordance with Part 4 of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board Ordinance (Cap. 453); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar of the Labour Tribunal in accordance with Part 4 of the Labour Tribunal Ordinance (Cap. 25). (Amended 61 of 1994 s. 51)

subsection.leadIn: A severance payment shall be made in legal tender except that, where the employee so consents, payment may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by cheque, money order or postal order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: into an account in his name with any bank within the meaning of section 2 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); or (Amended 49 of 1995 s. 53)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to his duly appointed agent.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: An employer who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Amended 9 of 2010 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: An employer who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (Replaced 103 of 1995 s. 8)

subsection.content: On making any severance payment, otherwise than in pursuance of a decision of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board or Labour Tribunal which specifies the amount of the payment to be made, the employer shall give to the employee a written statement indicating how the amount of the payment has been calculated. (Amended 61 of 1994 s. 52)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: An employer who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: An employer who in a statement under subsection (1) includes anything which to his knowledge is false in a material particular, or recklessly includes anything which is false in a material particular shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Replaced 103 of 1995 s. 9)

subsection.content: Without prejudice to any proceedings for an offence under subsection (2)(a), if an employer fails to comply with the requirements of subsection (1), the employee may by notice in writing to the employer require the employer to give to the employee a written statement complying with those requirements within such period (not being less than 1 week beginning with the day on which the notice was given) as may be specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: If, without reasonable excuse, an employer fails to comply with a notice under subsection (3) he shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a first conviction to a fine at level 3; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a second or subsequent conviction, to a fine at level 5. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 s. 9)

section.name: s31Q
section.heading: Presumption
section.content: For the purposes of this Part an employee who has been dismissed by his employer shall, unless the contrary is proved, be presumed to have been so dismissed by reason of redundancy.

part.name: P5B
part.heading: Long Service Payments
part.sourceNote: (Part VB added 76 of 1985 s. 8. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2017)

section.name: s31R
section.heading: General provisions as to employee’s right to long service payment

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee who has been employed under a continuous contract—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for not less than 5 years of service at the relevant date— (Amended 74 of 1997 s. 10)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is dismissed and his employer is not liable to pay him a severance payment by reason thereof; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subject to subsections (3) to (5), terminates his contract in the circumstances specified in section 10(aa); or (Amended 61 of 1993 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: terminates his contract and, at the relevant date, he is not less than 65 years of age and has been employed under that contract for not less than 5 years, (Amended 65 of 1995 s. 2)

subsection.continued: the employer shall, subject to this Part and Part VC, pay to the employee a long service payment calculated in accordance with section 31V(1). (Amended 105 of 1991 s. 2)

subsection.content: Where an employee has terminated his contract in the circumstances specified in section 10(aa) upon being certified as being permanently unfit for a particular type of work, the employer may require the employee to undergo a medical examination, at the employer’s expense, to obtain a second opinion as to whether or not the employee is permanently unfit for that type of work. (Replaced 16 of 2006 s. 6)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: A medical examination referred to in subsection (3) shall be conducted by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner named by the employer, regardless of whether the certificate issued in respect of the employee for the purposes of section 10(aa)(ii) was issued by a registered medical practitioner or registered Chinese medicine practitioner. (Added 16 of 2006 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: An employer shall forfeit his right to exercise the option under subsection (3) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he makes arrangements for a medical examination to take place not more than 14 days after the employer receives a copy of a certificate issued under section 10(aa); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he notifies the employee in writing, not less than 48 hours before the examination is to take place, giving him details of the appointment. (Added 61 of 1993 s. 5)

subsection.content: An employee referred to in subsection (3) who, without reasonable excuse, refuses to undergo a medical examination forfeits his right to a long service payment under this Part. (Added 61 of 1993 s. 5)

Where the second opinion obtained by an employer under subsection (3) comes to the opposite conclusion from the certificate issued under section 10(aa), the employer shall submit the certificate and the second opinion to the Commissioner and the Commissioner shall, after such consultation with such medical experts as he considers necessary, rule whether or not the employee is entitled to a long service payment under this Part. (Added 61 of 1993 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee dies and he had been at the time of his death employed under a continuous contract for not less than 5 years of service on the date of his death, the employer shall, subject to this Part and Part VC, pay a long service payment calculated in accordance with section 31V(1) to— (Amended 105 of 1991 s. 3; 74 of 1997 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the spouse of the employee, if the employee leaves a spouse; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the issue of the employee, if the employee leaves any issue but no spouse; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a parent of the employee, if the employee leaves neither a spouse nor issue; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the personal representative of the employee, if the employee does not leave any spouse, issue or parent.

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d) of subsection (1) shall not be entitled to such payment unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person serves an application in the form specified by the Commissioner under section 49 on the relevant employer within the period of 30 days beginning on the day next following the date of death of the employee or within such extended period as the Commissioner may allow; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant’s relationship (being a relationship mentioned in paragraph (a), (b), (c) or (d) of subsection (1)) to the deceased employee is supported by documentary evidence.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may extend the time for serving an application under subsection (2) although the application for extension is not made until after the expiration of the period of 30 days after the date of death of an employee.
Where a person referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of subsection (1) is a minor, the application under subsection (2) shall be made by the guardian of that person.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person is entitled to a long service payment under this section, the employer shall pay such person the long service payment to which he is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the person so entitled is a spouse, not later than 7 days after the receipt of the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person so entitled is not a spouse, not earlier than the day (hereinafter in this paragraph called the said day) next following the date of expiration of the period which, as regards the particular case, was the period during which an application under subsection (2)(a) could be served but not later than 7 days after the said day.

subsection.content: An employer who without reasonable excuse fails to pay a long service payment on or before the latest date for payment as required by subsection (5) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Amended 103 of 1995 s. 10)
Where 2 or more persons are entitled to a long service payment under this section, the long service payment shall be divided equally between such persons.

A long service payment is payable in accordance with this Part by an employer on the death of an employee from whatever cause and is payable in addition to any compensation payable by the employer under the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282).

section.name: s31RB
section.heading: Application to domestic servants
section.content: This Part (except section 31Z) shall apply to an employee who is employed as a domestic servant in, or in connection with, a private household as if the household were a business and the maintenance of the household were the carrying on of that business by the employer.

section.name: s31S
section.heading: General exclusions from right to long service payment by reason of dismissal

subsection.content: An employee shall not be entitled to a long service payment by reason of dismissal where his employer, being so entitled by reason of the employee’s conduct, terminates his contract of employment without notice or payment in lieu in accordance with section 9. (Amended 51 of 2000 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: An employee shall not be entitled to a long service payment by reason of dismissal where, having been given notice of the termination of his contract of employment by his employer in accordance with section 6, he leaves the service of his employer before the expiration of that notice unless he so leaves—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with the prior consent of the employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after having made a payment in lieu to the employer in accordance with section 7. (Replaced 75 of 1997 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), an employee employed under a contract for a fixed term shall not be entitled to a long service payment where he is taken to be dismissed by his employer under section 31T(1)(b) if, not less than 7 days before the relevant date, the employer has offered to renew his contract of employment, or to re-engage him under a new contract, so that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisions of the contract as renewed, or of the new contract, as the case may be, as to the capacity and place in which he would be employed, and as to the other terms and conditions of his employment, would not differ from the corresponding provisions of the contract as in force immediately before his dismissal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the renewal or re-engagement would take effect on or before the relevant date,

subsection.continued: and the employee has unreasonably refused that offer. (Added 75 of 1997 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), an employee employed under a contract for a fixed term shall not be entitled to a long service payment where he is taken to be dismissed by his employer under section 31T(1)(b) if, not less than 7 days before the relevant date, the employer has made to him an offer in writing to renew his contract of employment, or to re-engage him under a new contract, so that in accordance with the particulars specified in the offer the provisions of the contract as renewed, or of the new contract, as the case may be, as to the capacity and place in which he would be employed, and as to the other terms and conditions of his employment, would differ, wholly or in part, from the corresponding provisions of the contract as in force immediately before his dismissal, but—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the offer constitutes an offer of suitable employment in relation to the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the offer constitutes an offer of employment no less favourable to the employee than hitherto; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the renewal or re-engagement would take effect on or before the relevant date,

subsection.continued: and the employee has unreasonably refused that offer. (Added 75 of 1997 s. 3)

subsection.content: Where the relevant date falls on a rest day or holiday, the references in subsections (3)(b) and (4)(c) to the relevant date shall be construed as references to the next day after that rest day or holiday. (Added 75 of 1997 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting the application of section 31R(1)(a)(ii) and (b), where an employee employed under a contract for a fixed term, on or before the day on which the contract for a fixed term expires, refuses an offer of any of the descriptions mentioned in subsection (3) or (4)— (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employee is entitled to terminate that contract under section 31R(1)(a)(ii) and that expiration shall be regarded as termination of contract by the employee under section 31R(1)(a)(ii) for the purposes of the application of this Part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employee is entitled to terminate that contract under section 31R(1)(b) and that expiration shall be regarded as termination of contract by the employee under section 31R(1)(b) for the purposes of the application of this Part. (Added 75 of 1997 s. 3. Amended 4 of 2022 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of and subject to this Part, an employee shall be taken to be dismissed by his employer if, but only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contract under which he is employed is terminated by the employer with or without notice or payment in lieu thereof other than in accordance with section 9;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where under that contract he is employed for a fixed term, that term expires without being renewed under the same contract; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the employee terminates that contract with or without notice or payment in lieu, in circumstances such that he is entitled to terminate it without notice or payment in lieu in accordance with section 10 by reason of the employer’s conduct. (Replaced 62 of 1992 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: An employee shall not be taken for the purposes of this Part to be dismissed by his employer if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his contract of employment is renewed, or he is re-engaged by the same employer under a new contract of employment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the renewal or re-engagement takes effect immediately on the ending of his employment under the previous contract.

subsection.content: For the purposes of the application of subsection (2) to a contract under which the employment ends on a rest day or holiday, the renewal or re-engagement shall be treated as taking effect immediately on the ending of the employment under the previous contract if it takes effect on or before the next day after that rest day or holiday.

section.name: s31U
section.heading: Excluded classes of employees
section.leadIn: Sections 31R and 31RA shall not apply— (Amended 52 of 1988 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the employer is the husband or wife of the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any outworker;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to any person, employed by a government other than the Hong Kong Government, who is a subject or citizen of the state under whose government he is employed; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: without prejudice to paragraph (a), to any person in respect of employment as a domestic servant in, or in connection with, a private household, where the employer is the father, mother, grandfather, grandmother, stepfather, stepmother, son, daughter, grandson, granddaughter, stepson, stepdaughter, brother, sister, half-brother or half-sister of the employee.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Part, the amount of a long service payment payable under section 31R(1) or 31RA(1) shall be calculated by allowing— (Amended 105 of 1991 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a monthly rated employee, two-thirds of his last full month’s wages, or two-thirds of $22,500, whichever is less; or (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 8)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, 18 days’ wages based on any 18 days chosen by the employee and occurring during his last 30 normal working days, or two-thirds of $22,500, whichever is less, (Amended L.N. 264 of 1995)

subsection.continued: for every year (and pro rata as respects an incomplete year) of employment under a continuous contract by his employer subject in all cases to a maximum payment not exceeding, where the relevant date occurs in a period specified in column 1 of Table A in the Seventh Schedule, the amount specified in column 2 of that table opposite to the period. (Replaced 41 of 1990 s. 12. Amended 5 of 1995 s. 7)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the employee may, for a calculation under that subsection, elect to have the employee’s wages averaged over the period of 12 months immediately preceding the relevant date as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a monthly rated employee—the amount specified under paragraph (a) of that subsection for the calculation were two-thirds of the employee’s average monthly wages during such a period, or two-thirds of $22,500, whichever is less; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the amount specified under paragraph (b) of that subsection for the calculation were 18 times the employee’s average daily wages during such a period. (Replaced 4 of 2022 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: For calculating the average daily wages under subsection (1A)(b), the total wages for the period of 12 months must not exceed 12 times $22,500. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 8)

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 4 of Schedule 11. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 8)

section.name: s31Y
section.heading: Long service payment to be reduced by amount of gratuities and benefits in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee becomes entitled to payment of a long service payment under this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.content: because of the operation of that contract, one or more employer-funded (specified) ORS benefits have been paid to the employee;
one or more employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefits are being held in one or more mandatory provident fund schemes in respect of the employee, or have been paid to or in respect of the employee.

subsection.content: The long service payment is to be reduced by the aggregate amount of every one of the gratuities and benefits referred to in subsection (1)(b) to the extent that it relates to the employee’s years of service for which the long service payment is payable.

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 5 of Schedule 11.

section.name: s31YAA
section.heading: Gratuity or benefit to be reduced by amount of long service payment in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following conditions is met in relation to an employee—

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employee has been paid a long service payment under this Part. (Replaced 4 of 2022 s. 11)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The aggregate amount of every one of the gratuities and benefits referred to in subsection (1)(a) is to be reduced by the whole amount of the long service payment to the extent that it is attributable to the same years of service as those for which the long service payment is payable. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 11)
Subsection (1A) has effect even though the years of service for which the long service payment was made exceed those to which the gratuity or benefit is attributable. (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 11)

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 5 of Schedule 11. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 11)

section.name: s31YA
section.heading: Long service payment to be reduced by amount of gratuities and benefits on employee’s death

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee has died;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as a result of the death, a person becomes entitled to payment of a long service payment under section 31RA; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following conditions is met—

subparagraph.content: one or more employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefits are being held in one or more mandatory provident fund schemes in respect of the employee, or have been paid to or in respect of the employee.

subsection.content: The long service payment is to be reduced by the aggregate amount of every one of the gratuities and benefits referred to in subsection (1)(c) to the extent that it relates to the employee’s years of service for which the long service payment is payable.

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 5 of Schedule 11.

section.name: s31YB
section.heading: Gratuity or benefit to be reduced by amount of long service payment on employee’s death

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee has died;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following conditions is met in relation to a person—

subparagraph.content: as a result of the death, the person becomes entitled to payment of one or more employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefits; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a long service payment has been paid under section 31RA to the person in respect of the employee.

subsection.content: The aggregate amount of every one of the gratuities and benefits referred to in subsection (1)(b) is to be reduced by the whole amount of the long service payment to the extent that it is attributable to the same years of service as those for which the long service payment is payable.
Subsection (2) has effect even though the years of service for which the long service payment was made exceed those to which the gratuity or benefit is attributable.

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 5 of Schedule 11.

section.name: s31YC
section.heading: Certain persons’ entitlements to gratuities or benefits on employee’s death

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee has died;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following conditions is met in relation to another person (Person B)—

subparagraph.content: as a result of the death, Person B becomes entitled to payment of one or more employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefits.

subsection.content: A reference to a gratuity based on length of service, employer-funded (specified) ORS benefit or employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefit in subsection (1)(c) is a reference to such a gratuity or benefit relating to the employee’s years of service for which the long service payment is payable.

Person B is entitled to payment of any gratuities or benefits mentioned in subsection (1)(c) only to the extent that the aggregate amount of every one of such gratuities and benefits exceeds the amount of the long service payment.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employer has paid a long service payment mentioned in subsection (1)(b) to Person A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either or both of the following conditions are met—

subparagraph.content: as a result of the employee’s death, the approved trustee of a mandatory provident fund scheme has paid an employer-funded (voluntary) MPFS benefit to Person B.

subsection.content: Person B must repay the benefit to the administrator or trustee except for an amount the payment of which Person B is entitled to under subsection (3).
On being repaid the benefit, the administrator or trustee must pay it to the employer concerned.

statutoryNote.content: See also section 31ZEA, and section 5 of Schedule 11.

subsection.leadIn: This section shall have effect where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a change occurs (whether by virtue of a sale or other disposition or by operation of law) in the ownership of a business for the purposes of which a person is employed, or of a part of such a business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in connection with that change the person by whom the employee is employed immediately before the change occurs (in this section referred to as the previous owner) terminates the employee’s contract in accordance with section 6 or 7.

subsection.content: If, by agreement with the employee, the person who immediately after the change occurs is the owner of the business or of the part of the business in question, as the case may be, (in this section referred to as the new owner) renews the employee’s contract of employment (with the substitution of the new owner for the previous owner) or re-engages him under a new contract of employment, section 31T(2) shall have effect as if the renewal or re-engagement had been a renewal or re-engagement by the previous owner (without any substitution of the new owner for the previous owner).

subsection.leadIn: This section shall have effect (subject to the necessary modifications) in relation to a case where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person by whom a business, or part of a business, is owned immediately before a change is one of the persons by whom (whether as partners, trustees or otherwise) it is owned immediately after the change; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the persons by whom a business, or part of a business, is owned immediately before a change (whether as partners, trustees or otherwise) include the person or one or more of the persons by whom it is owned immediately after the change,

subsection.continued: as this section has effect where the previous owner and the new owner are wholly different persons.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall be construed as requiring any variation of a contract of employment by agreement between the parties to be treated as constituting a termination of the contract.
Where the employer is a company, any reference in this Part to re-engagement by the employer shall be construed as a reference to re-engagement by that company or by any associated company.

Subsection (1) shall not affect the operation of section 31Z in a case where the previous owner and the new owner (as defined by that section) are associated companies; and where that section applies, subsection (1) shall not apply.

Where an employee of a company is taken into the employment of another company which, at the time when he is taken into its employment, is an associated company of the first-mentioned company, his period of employment at that time shall count as a period of employment with the associated company, and the change of employer shall not break the continuity of the period of employment.

subsection.def: For the purposes of this section, 2 companies shall be taken to be associated companies if one is a subsidiary of the other, or both are subsidiaries of a third company, and associated company (相聯公司) shall be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: company (公司) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
subsidiary (附屬公司) has the meaning given by section 15 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for the purposes of that Ordinance. (Replaced 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

section.name: s31ZB
section.heading: Implied or constructive termination of contract
section.leadIn: Where in accordance with any enactment or rule of law—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any act on the part of the employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any event affecting an employer (including, in the case of an individual, his death),

section.continued: operates so as to terminate a contract under which an employee is employed by him, that act or event shall for the purposes of this Part be treated as a termination of the contract by the employer, if apart from this section it would not constitute a termination of the contract by him.

section.name: s31ZC
section.heading: Death of employer
section.content: The Sixth Schedule shall have effect in relation to the death of an employer.

subsection.leadIn: A long service payment shall be made in legal tender except that, where the person entitled to the payment so consents, payment may be made— (Amended 52 of 1988 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by cheque, money order or postal order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: into an account in his name with any bank within the meaning of section 2 of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155); or (Amended 49 of 1995 s. 53)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to his duly appointed agent.

subsection.content: Any employer who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 s. 11)

section.name: s31ZE
section.heading: Written particulars of long service payment
