subsection.content: Every medical certificate shall, in addition to specifying the number of days on which, in the opinion of the issuer of the certificate, the employee was, is or will be, as the case may be, unfit for work, specify the nature of the sickness or injury on account of which, in the opinion of the issuer of the certificate, the employee was, is or will be, as the case may be, unfit for work and, in the case of a medical certificate produced by an employee for the purposes of subsection (5A), the medical certificate shall, if so required by his employer, contain or be accompanied by a brief record of the investigation carried out and the treatment prescribed by the issuer of the certificate. (Amended 57 of 1983 s. 5; 5 of 1995 s. 9; 16 of 2006 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: An employee is entitled to sickness allowance in respect of a sickness day that falls within paragraph (b) of the definition of sickness day in section 2(1) only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of the employee’s absence from work lasts for 4 or more consecutive days; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sickness day falls on or after the specified date. (Added 5 of 2022 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (8), it does not matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the period of the employee’s absence from work begins before the specified date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the period relates to more than one Cap. 599 requirement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the period relates to more than one order, notice, declaration, direction or other instruction or request (however described) made, issued, published or given under the Prevention and Control of Disease Ordinance (Cap. 599). (Added 5 of 2022 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (8) and (9)—
subsection.def: +specified date (指明日期) means the day on which the Employment (Amendment) Ordinance 2022 (5 of 2022) is published in the Gazette. (Added 5 of 2022 s. 7)

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Requirements for certificate of attendance for medical examination in relation to pregnancy

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 33(5B), this section sets out the requirements for a certificate of attendance in relation to a female employee’s attendance on a particular day at a medical examination in relation to her pregnancy.

subsection.leadIn: The certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must state that the employee attends the examination on that day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), must be issued by a medical professional.

subsection.content: If the employee attends the examination as an in-patient in a hospital, the certificate must be issued by a medical professional who conducts the examination.

subsection.leadIn: If, in relation to the examination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employee takes paid sickness days entered in category 2 of the record kept for the employee under section 37(1A); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employer requires the employee to attend the examination in a hospital,

subsection.continued: the certificate must be issued by a medical professional who conducts the examination for the employee as an out-patient or in-patient in a hospital.

subsection.content: If the employer operates a recognized scheme of medical treatment, the certificate must be issued by a registered medical practitioner, or a registered Chinese medicine practitioner, engaged by the employer for the purposes of the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: However, subsection (5) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (3) or (4) applies in relation to the employee;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the employee chooses to be examined by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner and no registered Chinese medicine practitioner is engaged by the employer for the purposes of the scheme; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the employee has a reasonable excuse not to attend the examination under the scheme.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: hospital (醫院) has the meaning given by section 33(6)(a);

medical professional (醫療專業人員) means—(a)a registered medical practitioner;(b)a registered Chinese medicine practitioner;(c)a midwife registered under section 8 of the Midwives Registration Ordinance (Cap. 162) or deemed to be registered under section 25 of that Ordinance; or(d)a person with full registration, special registration or limited registration within the meaning of the Nurses Registration Ordinance (Cap. 164). (Replaced 24 of 2024 s. 91)

subsection.content: The Director may recognize for the purposes of this Ordinance a scheme of medical treatment operated by an employer, if he is satisfied that each employee, who is qualified to be paid sickness allowance by the employer by whom the scheme is operated, is provided, without expense to the employee, by a registered medical practitioner, registered Chinese medicine practitioner or registered dentist with such medical treatment as an out-patient as the Director considers reasonable. (Amended 5 of 1995 s. 10;16 of 2006 s. 8)
The Director may, having given to the employer by whom the scheme is operated not less than 1 month’s notice of his intention so to do, withdraw his recognition of any scheme of medical treatment.
Whenever the Director has recognized, or has withdrawn his recognition of, any scheme of medical treatment, he shall publish a notice thereof in the Gazette.

def.name: Wages
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2), (2A) and (2B), wages (工資) includes any sum paid by an employer in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a day of maternity leave, a day of paternity leave, a rest day, a sickness day, a holiday or a day of annual leave taken by the employee; (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 10)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a day of leave taken by the employee with the agreement of his employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a normal working day on which the employee is not provided with work;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a day of absence from work of the employee due to temporary incapacity for which compensation is payable under section 10 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282). (Replaced 7 of 2007 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: The daily rate of sickness allowance is a sum equivalent to four-fifths of the daily average of the wages earned by the employee during—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 12 months immediately before the sickness day or first sickness day (as appropriate); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee has been employed by the employer concerned for a period shorter than 12 months immediately before the sickness day or first sickness day (as appropriate), the shorter period,

subsection.continued: but no sickness allowance is payable in respect of a day on which the employee would not have worked had the employee not been sick or injured or absent from work due to the employee’s compliance with a Cap. 599 requirement and for which no wages would normally be payable by the employer. (Replaced 7 of 2007 s. 10. Amended 5 of 2022 s. 8)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: In calculating the daily average of the wages earned by an employee during the period of 12 months or the shorter period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any period therein for which the employee was not paid his wages or full wages by reason of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any maternity leave, paternity leave, rest day, sickness day, holiday or annual leave taken by the employee; (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 10)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any leave taken by the employee with the agreement of his employer;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: his not being provided by his employer with work on any normal working day; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: his absence from work due to temporary incapacity for which compensation is payable under section 10 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any wages paid to him for the period referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: are to be disregarded. (Added 7 of 2007 s. 10)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, if the amount of the wages paid to an employee in respect of a day specified in subsection (1) is only a fraction of the amount earned by the employee on a normal working day, the wages and the day are to be disregarded in accordance with subsection (2A). (Added 7 of 2007 s. 10)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.content: Despite subsection (2), if for any reason it is impracticable to calculate the daily average of the wages earned by an employee in the manner provided in that subsection, the amount may be calculated by reference to the wages earned by a person who was employed at the same work by the same employer during the period of 12 months immediately before the employee’s sickness day or first sickness day (as appropriate), or, if there is no such person, by a person who was employed in the same trade or occupation and at the same work in the same district during the period of 12 months immediately before the employee’s sickness day or first sickness day (as appropriate). (Added 7 of 2007 s. 10)

Where a contract of employment of an employee is terminated, sickness allowance payable under section 33(4C) shall be calculated in accordance with this section. (Added 48 of 1984 s. 15. Amended 7 of 2007 s. 10)

If, pursuant to the terms of his contract of employment or any other agreement or for any other reason, an employee is paid by his employer a sum of money in respect of a paid sickness day taken by him, the sickness allowance payable to the employee in respect of that sickness day is to be reduced by the sum. (Added 7 of 2007 s. 10)

section.name: s35A
section.heading: Transitional
section.content: Section 35 as in force immediately before the commencement* of the Employment (Amendment) Ordinance 1996 (60 of 1996) shall continue to apply in the calculation of sickness allowance payable to an employee under section 33 in respect of sickness days taken by that employee before that commencement.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Time for payment of sickness allowance

subsection.content: Except in the case of an employee who is normally paid his wages daily, sickness allowance shall be paid to the employee or his duly appointed agent in the manner and at the place specified in section 26 not later than the day on which the employee is next paid his wages.

In the case of an employee who is normally paid his wages daily, sickness allowance shall be paid to him or his duly appointed agent in the manner and at the place specified in section 26 at least once in every 7 days.

Where a contract of employment of an employee is terminated, sickness allowance payable under section 33(4C) shall be paid to that employee in accordance with subsection (1) or (2) whichever is applicable to the employee as if the contract of employment had not been terminated. (Added 48 of 1984 s. 16)

section.name: s37
section.heading: Employer to keep record of sickness days

subsection.leadIn: Every employer shall keep a record—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of the date of commencement and termination of the employment of each employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in accordance with subsection (1A), of all paid sickness days accumulated by each employee under section 33;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of all paid sickness days taken by each employee in respect of which sickness allowance is payable under section 33, and such sickness days shall be deducted in accordance with subsection (1B); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of all sickness allowance paid to each employee and the sickness days in respect of which the sickness allowance was paid. (Replaced 57 of 1983 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A record kept for the purposes of subsection (1)(b) shall contain the following heads and details—

tr.td: in which shall be entered the number of paid sickness days accumulated by an employee—
in respect of each month under section 33(2),
but so however that the total number of paid sickness days in this category does not at the time of entry exceed 36 days; and

in which shall be entered every paid sickness day in excess of 36 days which cannot be entered in category 1, but so however that the total number of paid sickness days in this category does not at the time of entry exceed 84 days,
and references in this section to category 1 and category 2 shall be construed as references to category 1 and category 2 respectively in this subsection. (Added 57 of 1983 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The number of paid sickness days taken consecutively by an employee shall be deducted from the total number of paid sickness days in category 1 accumulated by him immediately before the commencement of those sickness days and where the number of paid sickness days taken exceeds the total number of paid sickness days in that category, the excess paid sickness days shall be deducted from the total number of paid sickness days in category 2 accumulated by him immediately before such commencement. (Added 57 of 1983 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: If an employer maintains a record under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee who returns to work after a sickness day shall, as soon as is practicable but not later than 7 days after his return to work, sign the entry in the record specifying the days on which he has been absent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an employee shall be entitled to inspect that part of the record which relates to him at any reasonable time during working hours and, where an employee has ceased to be employed by his employer, he may inspect that part of the record which relates to him at any reasonable time during working hours in the period of 2 months next following the date on which he ceased to be employed.

subsection.content: If an employer fails to maintain the record under subsection (1) in respect of any employee employed by him, or if the record is lost or destroyed, the employee shall, notwithstanding any sickness allowance paid to him by his employer under section 33, be entitled to paid sickness days for each completed month of his employment in accordance with section 33. (Amended 57 of 1983 s. 6)

section.name: s38
section.heading: Records to be produced to Commissioner
section.content: For the purposes of section 37, the Commissioner may, either by notice in writing served by registered post or by notice in the Gazette, require any employer or class of employers to send to him all or any records of sickness days in respect of any period not exceeding 2 years preceding the date of the notice.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Holidays with Pay
part.sourceNote: (Part VIII added 39 of 1973 s. 5. Format changes—E.R. 2 of 2012)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (1A), (2) and (3), an employee shall be granted a statutory holiday by his employer on each of the following days*— (Amended 137 of 1997 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Lunar New Year’s Day or, if that day falls on a Sunday, then the fourth day of Lunar New Year; (Amended 27 of 1982 s. 2; 23 of 2011 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the second day of Lunar New Year or, if that day falls on a Sunday, then the fourth day of Lunar New Year; (Amended 23 of 2011 s. 5)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the third day of Lunar New Year or, if that day falls on a Sunday, then the fourth day of Lunar New Year; (Amended 23 of 2011 s. 5)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Ching Ming (清明) Festival;

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: Labour Day, being the first day of May; (Added 100 of 1997 s. 2. Amended 35 of 1998 s. 5)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Tuen Ng (端午) Festival; (Amended 35 of 1998 s. 5)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the day following the Chinese Mid-Autumn (中秋) Festival or, if that day falls on a Sunday, then the second day following that Festival; (Amended 27 of 1982 s. 2; 23 of 2011 s. 5);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Chung Yeung (重陽) Festival;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the Chinese Winter Solstice Festival (冬節) or Christmas Day, at the option of the employer;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the first day of January; (Replaced 53 of 1976 s. 2)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Establishment Day, being the first day of July; (Added 137 of 1997 s. 3. Amended 35 of 1998 s. 5; 21 of 2021 s. 3)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: National Day, being the first day of October; (Added 137 of 1997 s. 3. Amended 35 of 1998 s. 5; 21 of 2021 s. 3)
the Birthday of the Buddha, being the eighth day of the fourth lunar month; (Added and amended 21 of 2021 s. 3)
the first weekday after Christmas Day. (Added 21 of 2021 s. 3)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The operation of subsection (1)(da) shall be suspended for the year 1998. (Added 137 of 1997 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: An employer may, instead of granting an employee a holiday on a statutory holiday, grant the employee an alternative holiday on another day (which is not a statutory holiday or a substituted holiday) within the period of 60 days immediately preceding or next following the statutory holiday, if the employer has notified the employee, either orally or in writing or by notice posted in a conspicuous place in the place of employment, of the day on which he will be granted the alternative holiday—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the alternative holiday is to be taken on a day within the period of 60 days immediately preceding the statutory holiday, not less than 48 hours before that day; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the alternative holiday is to be taken on a day within the period of 60 days next following the statutory holiday, not less than 48 hours before the statutory holiday.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Subsection (2) shall apply to and in relation to a holiday under subsection (4) as it applies to and in relation to a statutory holiday. (Added 137 of 1997 s. 3)

An employer and his employee may agree that another day shall be substituted for a statutory holiday or an alternative holiday or a holiday under subsection (4), if such substituted holiday falls within the period of 30 days of such statutory holiday, alternative holiday or holiday under subsection (4). (Amended 27 of 1982 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statutory holiday falls on a rest day, or in the case of an employee who is a young person, on a day on which, by virtue of the Employment of Young Persons (Industry) Regulations (Cap. 57 sub. leg. C), the employment of the employee in an industrial undertaking is not allowed, the employee shall be granted a holiday on the next day thereafter which is not a statutory holiday or an alternative holiday or a substituted holiday or a rest day; or (Amended 7 of 2001 s. 9)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statutory holiday falls on the same day as that of another statutory holiday, an employee shall be granted a holiday on the next day thereafter which is not a statutory holiday or an alternative holiday or a substituted holiday or a rest day. (Replaced 137 of 1997 s. 3)

tr.td: For additional statutory holidays in 1981, 1986, 1997 and 2015, see 39 of 1981, 35 of 1986, 84 of 1997, s. 2(1) of 111 of 1997 and s. 2(b) of 9 of 2015.
For savings provisions, please see s. 6 of 137 of 1997.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Payment of holiday pay
section.content: Subject to section 12(11), an employee who has been employed by his employer under a continuous contract for a period of 3 months immediately preceding a statutory holiday shall, not later than the day on which the employee is next paid his wages after that holiday, be paid by his employer holiday pay at the rate specified in section 41, whether the employee takes a holiday on the statutory holiday or on an alternative or substituted holiday or a holiday under section 39(4).

section.name: s40A
section.heading: Restriction on pay in lieu of holiday

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), no payment of holiday pay payable under section 40, or other sum, shall be made in lieu of the grant of a holiday.

Notwithstanding subsection (1), where a contract of employment of an employee is terminated, holiday pay in respect of a holiday granted as an alternative holiday or substituted holiday under section 39(2), (2A) or (3) prior to the termination of the contract of employment but falling after such termination shall be paid to that employee as soon as is practicable but in any case not later than 7 days after the day of termination; and such holiday pay shall be calculated in accordance with section 41 as if the contract of employment had not been terminated. (Amended 137 of 1997 s. 4; 7 of 2007 s. 11)

def.name: Wages
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2), (3) and (4), wages (工資) includes any sum paid by an employer in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a day of maternity leave, a day of paternity leave, a rest day, a sickness day, a holiday or a day of annual leave taken by the employee; (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a day of leave taken by the employee with the agreement of his employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a normal working day on which the employee is not provided with work;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a day of absence from work of the employee due to temporary incapacity for which compensation is payable under section 10 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282).

subsection.leadIn: The daily rate of holiday pay is a sum equivalent to the daily average of the wages earned by the employee during—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 12 months immediately before the holiday or first day of the holidays (as appropriate); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee has been employed by the employer concerned for a period shorter than 12 months immediately before the holiday or first day of the holidays (as appropriate), the shorter period.

subsection.leadIn: In calculating the daily average of the wages earned by an employee during the period of 12 months or the shorter period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any period therein for which the employee was not paid his wages or full wages by reason of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any maternity leave, paternity leave, rest day, sickness day, holiday or annual leave taken by the employee; (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 11)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any leave taken by the employee with the agreement of his employer;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: his not being provided by his employer with work on any normal working day; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: his absence from work due to temporary incapacity for which compensation is payable under section 10 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any wages paid to him for the period referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: are to be disregarded.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, if the amount of the wages paid to an employee in respect of a day specified in subsection (1) is only a fraction of the amount earned by the employee on a normal working day, the wages and the day are to be disregarded in accordance with subsection (3).

Despite subsection (2), if for any reason it is impracticable to calculate the daily average of the wages earned by an employee in the manner provided in that subsection, the amount may be calculated by reference to the wages earned by a person who was employed at the same work by the same employer during the period of 12 months immediately before the employee’s holiday or first day of the holidays (as appropriate), or, if there is no such person, by a person who was employed in the same trade or occupation and at the same work in the same district during the period of 12 months immediately before the employee’s holiday or first day of the holidays (as appropriate).

If, pursuant to the terms of his contract of employment or any other agreement or for any other reason, an employee is paid by his employer a sum of money in respect of a holiday taken by him, the holiday pay payable to the employee in respect of that holiday is to be reduced by the sum.

part.name: P8A
part.heading: Annual Leave with Pay
part.sourceNote: (Part VIIIA added 53 of 1977 s. 3. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2015)

section.name: s41A
section.heading: Definitions (Part VIIIA)
section.leadIn: In this Part, in relation to an employee—

def.name: AppropriateDay
def.leadIn: appropriate day (適用日) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the employee becomes entitled under section 41F(3) to any annual leave, the first day of the close down as regards which the entitlement arises or where he becomes so entitled more than once in any period of 12 months, the first day of the more or most recent, as appropriate, of such close downs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the employee does not become so entitled—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the day following the end of the employee’s last (or only) leave year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is no such leave year, the day on which his employment commenced;

section.def: final employment period (最終僱傭期) means the period beginning on the appropriate day and ending on the termination of his employment;

def.name: LeaveYear
def.leadIn: leave year (假期年), unless the context otherwise requires, means any period of 12 months— (Amended 61 of 1993 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: commencing on—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in case the employee is entitled under section 41F(3) to any annual leave, the first day of the close down as regards which the entitlement arose; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of any other employee, the day on which his employment commenced; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: commencing on an anniversary of such day;

section.def: notional leave pay (假定假期薪酬) means an amount equal to the annual leave pay which would have been due to the employee had his contract of employment terminated, or been terminated, on the appropriate day’s anniversary next following such contract’s actual termination and had that pay been calculated in accordance with section 41C. (Amended 7 of 2007 s. 13)

subsection.content: Subject to this Part, every employee who has been in employment under a continuous contract for not less than 12 months shall, in respect of each leave year, be entitled to paid leave (in this Part referred to as annual leave) calculated in accordance with subsection (2).

Where an employee has been in employment under a continuous contract for a period specified in column (1) of the Table to this section, the amount of annual leave to which he shall be entitled in respect of any leave year in that period shall be the number of days specified in column (2) of such Table in respect of the period.
Subject to subsection (5)(c), times at which annual leave is granted shall be determined by the employer after consultation with the employee concerned or his representatives.

An employer shall give an employee not less than 14 days’ notice in writing of the time he has determined for the grant of a period of annual leave, except where a shorter period of notice is agreed to by the employer and employee.

subsection.leadIn: Annual leave to which an employee is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be granted by his employer and be taken by the employee within the period of 12 months beginning immediately after the expiration of the leave year to which it relates;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (c), shall be for an unbroken period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (9), shall, if the employee so requests his employer, be divided as follows—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where the leave entitlement does not exceed 10 days, it shall be granted on consecutive days except that not more than 3 days of the period of leave may be granted on any day or days (whether consecutive or not); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where such entitlement exceeds 10 days, 7 days of the period of leave shall be granted on consecutive days and the remaining leave may be granted on any day or days (whether consecutive or not).

subsection.content: If a rest day or holiday falls within any period of annual leave granted in accordance with this section, it shall be counted as annual leave and another rest day or holiday shall be substituted in accordance with section 18(5) or section 39(2), (2A), (3) or (4), as the case may require. (Amended 137 of 1997 s. 5)

No period of total incapacity for work by reason of sickness or injury or absence from work due to the employee’s compliance with a Cap. 599 requirement occurring during a period of annual leave shall count as part of that annual leave unless it commences after the commencement of the period of annual leave. (Amended 5 of 2022 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an employer continues to employ an employee after the expiration of a period during which annual leave should have been granted to him and the employer has not granted that leave, then at the option of the employee but subject to paragraph (b) the employer shall (whether or not proceedings have been taken for an offence under section 63(4)(e))—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pay to the employee, in addition to any pay due to him, compensation equal in amount to the annual leave pay which he would have received had the leave been granted so as to end on the expiration of the period during which it should have been granted; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: grant the employee paid leave equal to the leave which should have been granted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an employee opts under paragraph (a) to take paid leave, he shall take the leave on such day or days as may be agreed to by the employer and him or, if there is no such agreement, as shall be specified by the employer.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employer proposes to close down his business or part thereof for the purpose of granting annual leave to any of his employees; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notice of the proposed close down is duly given under section 41F; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: such close down will not result in any person who has been in employment in the business under a continuous contract for 12 months or more having to take annual leave on fewer consecutive days than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where his leave entitlement does not exceed 10 days, the number of consecutive days’ leave that would be required to be granted under subsection (5)(c)(i) were his leave being divided under that subsection;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 7 days where his leave entitlement exceeds 10 days,

subsection.continued: then nothing in this section shall prevent or restrict, or be construed as preventing or restricting, the close down.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt it is declared that annual leave is, and shall be granted, in addition to the rest days, holidays, maternity leave and paternity leave to which an employee is entitled under this Ordinance. (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 12)

subsection.content: Notwithstanding anything in this Part, an employer may, at his option, elect to use a 12 month period determined by him as the leave year for the purpose of calculating the annual leave of all of his employees and, in that case, each of his employees is entitled to an annual leave under this Part determined in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: An employer shall, before making an election under this section, give 1 month’s notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to each of his employees in writing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by posting a notice in a conspicuous place in the place of employment,

subsection.continued: stating his intention to make the election, the 12 month period he intends to elect to use and the date from which he will commence using it.

subsection.leadIn: Where an employer makes an election under this section, he shall thenceforth use that 12 month period as the leave year for the purpose of calculating the annual leave entitlement of all of his employees and, where an employee has not been in employment under a continuous contract for the full period of a leave year—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employer shall calculate the leave entitlement on a pro rata basis, based on the number of calendar days between the day the employee commenced employment and the end of the leave year, divided by 365, and any fraction of a day resulting from the calculation shall be counted as a full day’s leave; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the employee may, at his option—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: after consultation with his employer, take his leave entitlement for the pro rata portion referred to in paragraph (a); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: carry it forward and combine it with his leave entitlement for the next full leave year.

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee was already employed on the day an employer commences using a 12 month period for calculating annual leave for all of his employees under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the employee is entitled to an annual leave calculated on a pro rata basis, based on the number of calendar days between the day he commenced employment (or the anniversary of such day, as the case may be) and the day preceding the day on which the employer commenced using the 12 month period under this section, divided by 365, and any fraction of a day resulting from the calculation shall be counted as a full day’s leave; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the employee may, at his option—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: after consultation with his employer, take his leave entitlement for the pro rata portion referred to in paragraph (a); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: carry it forward and combine it with his leave entitlement for the first full leave year calculated in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: Where section 41F applies to an employer who has made an election under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the annual leave granted shall be in respect of the leave year immediately preceding the period of the close down; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 41F(3) to (6) shall not apply to the calculation of the leave entitlement.

section.name: s41B
section.heading: Payment of annual leave pay
section.content: Where an employee is granted any period of annual leave, the employer shall pay him annual leave pay in respect of that period not later than the day on which he is next paid his wages after that period.

def.name: Wages
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (2), (3) and (4), wages (工資) includes any sum paid by an employer in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a day of maternity leave, a day of paternity leave, a rest day, a sickness day, a holiday or a day of annual leave taken by the employee; (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 13)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a day of leave taken by the employee with the agreement of his employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a normal working day on which the employee is not provided with work;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a day of absence from work of the employee due to temporary incapacity for which compensation is payable under section 10 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282).

subsection.leadIn: The daily rate of annual leave pay is a sum equivalent to the daily average of the wages earned by the employee during—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 12 months immediately before the day of annual leave, the first day of the annual leave or the date of termination of the contract of employment (as appropriate); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the employee has been employed by the employer concerned for a period shorter than 12 months immediately before the day of annual leave, the first day of the annual leave or the date of termination of the contract (as appropriate), the shorter period.

subsection.leadIn: In calculating the daily average of the wages earned by an employee during the period of 12 months or the shorter period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any period therein for which the employee was not paid his wages or full wages by reason of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any maternity leave, paternity leave, rest day, sickness day, holiday or annual leave taken by the employee; (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 13)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any leave taken by the employee with the agreement of his employer;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: his not being provided by his employer with work on any normal working day; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: his absence from work due to temporary incapacity for which compensation is payable under section 10 of the Employees’ Compensation Ordinance (Cap. 282); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any wages paid to him for the period referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: are to be disregarded.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, if the amount of the wages paid to an employee in respect of a day specified in subsection (1) is only a fraction of the amount earned by the employee on a normal working day, the wages and the day are to be disregarded in accordance with subsection (3).

Despite subsection (2), if for any reason it is impracticable to calculate the daily average of the wages earned by an employee in the manner provided in that subsection, the amount may be calculated by reference to the wages earned by a person who was employed at the same work by the same employer during the period of 12 months immediately before the employee’s day of annual leave, the first day of his annual leave or the date of termination of his contract of employment (as appropriate), or, if there is no such person, by a person who was employed in the same trade or occupation and at the same work in the same district during the period of 12 months immediately before the employee’s day of annual leave, the first day of his annual leave or the date of termination of his contract of employment (as appropriate).

If, pursuant to the terms of his contract of employment or any other agreement or for any other reason, an employee is paid by his employer a sum of money in respect of a day of annual leave taken by him, the annual leave pay payable to the employee in respect of that day of annual leave is to be reduced by the sum.

section.name: s41D
section.heading: Payment of annual leave pay on cesser of employment

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee ceases to be employed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: annual leave is due to him,

subsection.continued: the person by whom he was formerly employed shall, as soon as practicable and in any case not later than 7 days after such cesser, pay to him in respect of the annual leave compensation equal in amount to the annual leave pay he would have received had the leave so due been granted immediately after such cesser.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an employee ceases to be employed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cesser occurs otherwise than on the expiration of a leave year of the employee;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: his contract of employment terminates or is terminated otherwise than under section 9 for any reason whatsoever (including his resignation); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the termination occurs at least 3 months after the appropriate day,

subsection.continued: he shall, as soon as practicable and in any case not later than 7 days after the termination, be paid by the person by whom he was formerly employed, in addition to any sum due under subsection (1), a sum equal in amount to that which bears to the notional leave pay the same proportion as the number of days in the final employment period bears to 365.

section.name: s41E
section.heading: Restriction on pay in lieu of leave

subsection.content: Where an employee is entitled to annual leave, subject to sections 41AA(8)(a) and 41D and to subsection (2), no remuneration shall be paid to him by his employer in lieu of his taking all or any part of the annual leave.

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee is entitled to more than 10 days’ annual leave in respect of a particular leave year, he may, in lieu of taking part of the leave, work on not more than the number of days by which such annual leave exceeds 10, and in case an employee so agrees, the amount payable to him in respect of any such day shall not be less than the aggregate of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the wages receivable by him in respect of the period worked on that day; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the annual leave pay he would have received had he been granted leave on that day.

section.name: s41EA
section.heading: Inclusion of certain provisions in contracts of employment prohibited
section.content: The inclusion by any person in a contract of employment of any term or condition which purports to affect in any way the provisions of section 41E(2) in their application to such employee, is prohibited and any such term or condition, if so included, shall be void.

subsection.content: Every employer who intends to close down his business or part thereof for the purpose of granting annual leave to any of his employees shall give one month’s notice in writing of his intention so to do to every employee who will as a result have to take annual leave or otherwise stop work during the period of closure.

The provisions of subsection (1) shall be deemed to be complied with if not later than one month before commencement of the period of closure, the employer exhibits in a conspicuous place in the place of employment notice of the closure and of the names of all employees who will as a result have to take annual leave or otherwise stop working, or in lieu of such names, a description or other details enabling such employees to be clearly identified.

Every person who is an employee at the commencement of the period during which the business or part thereof is closed down for the purpose specified in subsection (1), and who is not otherwise entitled to annual leave pay in respect of any day during that period, shall, as regards the period beginning on the appropriate day and ending on the day preceding the first day of the close down, be entitled to annual leave calculated in accordance with subsection (4). (Amended 53 of 1990 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: The amount of annual leave to which an employee is entitled under subsection (3) shall be determined as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn:
a calculation shall be made using the formula
A × B
365
where─

subparagraph.content: is the number of days in the period beginning on the relevant day and ending on the day preceding the first day of the close down as regards which the entitlement arose; and

is the annual leave to which the employee would be entitled under this Ordinance had there been no close down (or partial close down) of the business concerned and had he been in his employment under a continuous contract for the period of 12 months beginning on the relevant day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the result is not a whole number, the result shall be rounded up to the next whole number; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the result or, where appropriate, the result when rounded up (which result in this section referred to as the calculated number) equals or is less than the number of days occurring during the relevant close down being days and as regards none of which the employee is, apart from subsection (3), entitled to annual leave (which days are in this section referred to as relevant closure days), the amount of annual leave shall equal the number of relevant closure days; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the calculated number exceeds the number of relevant closure days, the number of days of annual leave shall equal the calculated number. (Added 53 of 1990 s. 4)

subsection.content: Where an employee is entitled to annual leave under subsection (3) and such leave exceeds the relevant closure days, unless the employee and his employer otherwise agree, the remaining annual leave shall be granted by the employer and be taken by the employee during an unbroken period beginning on the working day next following the last day of the relevant close down or, in case there is only 1 day’s remaining annual leave, it shall be so given and taken on such working day. (Added 53 of 1990 s. 4)

For the avoidance of doubt it is hereby declared that where an employee is entitled to annual leave under subsection (3), no period shall, by reason only of the entitlement, be regarded for the purposes of this Ordinance as being a leave year. (Added 53 of 1990 s. 4)

def.name: TheRelevantDay
def.leadIn: In this section the relevant day (有關日期) means, in relation to an employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the employee previously became entitled under subsection (3) to any annual leave in the immediately preceding period of 12 months, the first day of the close down as regards which the entitlement arose, or where he became so entitled more than once in such period of 12 months, the first day of the more or most recent, as appropriate, of such close downs; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in any other case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the day following the end of the employee’s last (or only) leave year; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where there is no such leave year, the day on which his employment commenced. (Added 53 of 1990 s. 4)

section.name: s41G
section.heading: Employer to keep annual leave records
section.leadIn: Every employer shall keep a record of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the date of commencement and termination of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the employment of each employee;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: all periods of annual leave taken by each employee; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: all periods of closure of his business or part thereof for the purpose of granting any annual leave to any of his employees; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all annual leave pay received by each employee.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Ancillary Provisions relating to Sickness Allowance and Holidays and Annual Leave with Pay
part.sourceNote: (Part IX added 39 of 1973 s. 5. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2015)
(Amended 53 of 1977 s. 4)

section.name: s43
section.heading: Payment of holiday pay, etc. in event of bankruptcy, etc.
section.content: For the purposes of section 38 of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) and section 265 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), any holiday pay, annual leave pay, end of year payment or any proportion thereof, maternity leave pay, paternity leave pay or sickness allowance to which an employee is entitled shall, whenever the employee became or becomes entitled thereto, be deemed to be wages in respect of services rendered during the relevant period prescribed in the said section 38 or the said section 265 or in section 79 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32), as the case may be.

part.name: P9A
part.heading: Liability to Pay Wages of Sub-contractor’s and Nominated Sub-contractor’s Employees
part.sourceNote: (Part IXA added 54 of 1977 s. 2. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: BuildingWorks
def.leadIn: building works (建築工程) means the construction, site formation, reconstruction, maintenance (including redecoration and external cleaning), repairs, alteration or demolition of the whole or any part of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any building, dock, pier, bridge, viaduct or other structure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any harbour or port works, reclamation, road, tunnel, sewer, drain, well or waterworks,

def.continued: and any installation works in respect of such building works;

subsection.def: main nominated sub-contractor (主要指定次承判商) means a nominated sub-contractor who enters into a contract, express or implied, directly with a principal contractor to perform all or any part of the work which the principal contractor has contracted to perform;

def.name: NominatedSubcontractor
def.leadIn: nominated sub-contractor (指定次承判商) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any person—

subparagraph.content: who enters into a contract, express or implied, with a principal contractor to perform all or any part of the work which the principal contractor has contracted to perform; or
who enters into a contract, express or implied, to perform all or any part of the work which a person referred to in sub-paragraph (i) has contracted to perform,

paragraph.continued: who is nominated by an owner or occupier of property, or by an agent or authorized architect, surveyor or civil, municipal or structural engineer of such owner or occupier; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person who subsequently enters into a contract, express or implied, to perform all or any part of the work agreed to be performed by a nominated sub-contractor within the meaning of paragraph (a) of this definition;

subsection.def: principal contractor (總承判商) means a person who enters into a contract directly with an owner or occupier of property, or with an agent or authorized architect, surveyor or civil, municipal or structural engineer of such owner or occupier, to perform any work for such owner or occupier;

def.name: Subcontractor
def.leadIn: sub-contractor (次承判商) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person who enters into a contract, express or implied, with a principal contractor to perform all or any part of the work which the principal contractor has contracted to perform; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who enters into a contract, express or implied, to perform all or any part of the work which a sub-contractor within the meaning of paragraph (a) has contracted to perform,

def.continued: but does not include a nominated sub-contractor;

def.name: Work
def.leadIn: work (工作) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the supply of manual labour for the purposes of or in connection with building works.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sub-contractor is a superior sub-contractor to another sub-contractor if all or any part of the work which he contracted to perform is sub-contracted to that other sub-contractor, whether or not such work is performed by that other sub-contractor or further sub-contracted by that other sub-contractor;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a nominated sub-contractor is a superior nominated sub-contractor to another nominated sub-contractor if all or any part of the work which he contracted to perform is sub-contracted to that other nominated sub-contractor, whether or not such work is performed by that other nominated sub-contractor or further sub-contracted by that other nominated sub-contractor.

section.name: s43B
section.heading: Application
section.content: This Part shall not apply to wages for any work for which a contract was entered into by a principal contractor, nominated sub-contractor or sub-contractor prior to the commencement* of the Employment (Amendment) (No. 4) Ordinance 1977 (54 of 1977).

section.name: s43C
section.heading: Liability of principal contractor and superior sub-contractor to pay wages of employees of sub-contractors

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Part, if any wages become due to an employee who is employed by a sub-contractor on any work which the sub-contractor has contracted to perform, and such wages are not paid within the period specified in section 23, 24 or 25, as the case may be, such wages shall be payable to the employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the sub-contractor has contracted with the principal contractor, by the principal contractor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the sub-contractor has contracted with a superior sub-contractor, by the principal contractor and every superior sub-contractor to the sub-contractor, jointly and severally.

subsection.leadIn: The liability of a principal contractor and of a principal contractor and superior sub-contractor or superior sub-contractors jointly and severally under subsection (1) shall be limited—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the wages of an employee whose employment relates wholly to the work which the principal contractor has contracted to perform and whose place of employment is wholly on the site of the building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the wages due to such an employee for 2 months without any deductions under this Ordinance and such months shall be the first 2 months of the period in respect of which the wages are due to the employee.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4) the wages payable under subsection (1) shall be paid by the principal contractor or superior sub-contractor, as the case may be, not later than 30 days after the date on which a notice under section 43D is received by him or service thereof is deemed to be effected on him.

Where any claim in respect of the wages payable under subsection (1) is filed with the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board or Labour Tribunal and an award or order is made in favour of the employee, the wages shall be paid within such time as the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board or Labour Tribunal may direct, or, in the absence of any direction, not later than 30 days after the making of the award or order. (Amended 61 of 1994 s. 53)

section.name: s43D
section.heading: Notice by employee to principal contractor

subsection.leadIn: Where the wages of an employee who is employed by a sub-contractor are not paid by his employer within the period specified in section 23, 24 or 25, as the case may be, the employee shall serve on the principal contractor, within 60 days (or such other additional period not exceeding 90 days as the Commissioner may permit) after the date on which the wages become due, a notice in writing stating the— (Amended 48 of 1984 s. 22)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: name and address of the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: name and address of his employer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: address of the place of employment of the employee;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: particulars of the work in respect of which the wages are due; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: amount of wages due and the period to which they relate.

subsection.content: A principal contractor who receives a notice under subsection (1) from an employee of a sub-contractor shall, within 14 days after the receipt of the notice, serve a copy of the notice on every superior sub-contractor to that sub-contractor (if any) of whom he is aware.

A principal contractor and superior sub-contractor (if any) shall not be liable to pay any wages under section 43C to the employee of a sub-contractor if that employee fails to serve a notice on the principal contractor under subsection (1).

A principal contractor who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 s. 14)

section.name: s43E
section.heading: Employer to supply information at request of employee

subsection.content: Where an employer who is a sub-contractor fails to pay, within the period specified in section 23, 24 or 25, as the case may be, any wages due to an employee employed by him on work which he has contracted to perform, he shall within 7 days of the receipt of a written request made by the employee supply to the employee the name and address of the principal contractor and every superior sub-contractor to him and shall, within such 7 days’ period, deliver a copy of the written request to the principal contractor and every superior sub-contractor to him.

An employer who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 s. 15)

section.name: s43F
section.heading: Recovery of wages paid by principal contractor or superior sub-contractor

subsection.content: If a principal contractor or superior sub-contractor pays to an employee any wages under section 43C, the wages so paid shall be a debt due by the employer of that employee to the principal contractor or superior sub-contractor, as the case may be.

subsection.leadIn: Any principal contractor or superior sub-contractor who pays to an employee any wages under section 43C may either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: claim contribution from every superior sub-contractor to the employee’s employer or from the principal contractor and every other such superior sub-contractor as the case may be; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: deduct by way of set-off the amount paid by him from any sum due or which may become due—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to any sub-contractor to whom he has sub-contracted all or any part of work that he contracted to perform being work upon which the employee was employed, and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in respect of the work that he has sub-contracted.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section any amount—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: paid by a principal contractor or a superior sub-contractor by way of contribution under subsection (2)(a), or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deducted by a principal contractor or a superior sub-contractor from any sum due by him by way of set-off under subsection (2)(b),

subsection.continued: shall be deemed to be payment by the principal contractor or superior sub-contractor who has paid the amount by way of contribution or by the superior sub-contractor who has suffered a deduction from any sum due to him by way of set-off to an employee of wages under section 43C.

section.name: s43G
section.heading: Liability of superior nominated sub-contractor to pay wages of employees of nominated sub-contractors

subsection.content: Subject to this Part, if any wages become due to an employee who is employed by a nominated sub-contractor on any work which the nominated sub-contractor has contracted to perform, and such wages are not paid within the period specified in section 23, 24 or 25, as the case may be, such wages shall be payable to the employee by every superior nominated sub-contractor to the nominated sub-contractor by whom the employee is employed, jointly and severally.

subsection.leadIn: The liability of a superior nominated sub-contractor or superior nominated sub-contractors jointly and severally under subsection (1) shall be limited—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the wages of an employee whose employment relates wholly to the work which the main nominated sub-contractor has contracted to perform whether or not his place of employment is on the site of the building works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the wages due to such an employee for 2 months without any deductions under this Ordinance and such months shall be the first 2 months of the period in respect of which the wages are due to the employee.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4) the wages payable under subsection (1) shall be paid by the superior nominated sub-contractor not later than 30 days after the date on which a notice under section 43H is received by him or service thereof is deemed to be effected on him.

Where any claim in respect of the wages payable under subsection (1) is filed with the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board or Labour Tribunal and an award or order is made in favour of the employee, the wages shall be paid within such time as the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board or Labour Tribunal may direct, or, in the absence of any direction, not later than 30 days after the making of the award or order. (Amended 61 of 1994 s. 54)

section.name: s43H
section.heading: Notice by employee to main nominated sub-contractor

subsection.content: Where the wages of an employee who is employed by a nominated sub-contractor are not paid by his employer within the period specified in section 23, 24 or 25, as the case may be, the employee shall serve on the main nominated sub-contractor, within 60 days (or such other additional period not exceeding 90 days as the Commissioner may permit) after the date on which the wages became due, a notice in writing containing the particulars specified in section 43D(1). (Amended 48 of 1984 s. 23)

A main nominated sub-contractor who receives a notice under subsection (1) from an employee of a nominated sub-contractor shall, within 14 days after the receipt of the notice, serve a copy of the notice on every superior nominated sub-contractor to that nominated sub-contractor (if any) of whom he is aware.

A superior nominated sub-contractor shall not be liable to pay any wages under section 43G to the employee of a nominated sub-contractor if that employee fails to serve a notice on the main nominated sub-contractor under subsection (1).

A main nominated sub-contractor who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 s. 16)

section.name: s43I
section.heading: Employer to supply information at request of employee

subsection.content: Where an employer who is a nominated sub-contractor fails to pay, within the period specified in section 23, 24 or 25, as the case may be, any wages due to an employee employed by him on work which he has contracted to perform, he shall within 7 days of the receipt of a written request made by the employee supply to the employee the name and address of the main nominated sub-contractor and every superior nominated sub-contractor to him and shall, within such 7 days’ period, deliver a copy of the written request to the main nominated sub-contractor and every superior nominated sub-contractor to him.

An employer who without reasonable excuse fails to comply with subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 1995 s. 17)

section.name: s43J
section.heading: Recovery of wages paid by superior nominated sub-contractor

subsection.content: If a superior nominated sub-contractor pays to an employee any wages under section 43G, the wages so paid shall be a debt due by the employer of that employee to the superior nominated sub-contractor.

subsection.leadIn: Any superior nominated sub-contractor who pays to an employee any wages under section 43G may either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: claim contribution from every other superior nominated sub-contractor to the employee’s employer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: deduct by way of set-off the amount paid by him from any sum due or which may become due—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to any nominated sub-contractor to whom he has sub-contracted all or any part of work that he contracted to perform being work upon which the employee was employed; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in respect of the work that he has sub-contracted.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section any amount—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: paid by a superior nominated sub-contractor by way of contribution under subsection (2)(a), or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deducted by a superior nominated sub-contractor from any sum due by him by way of set-off under subsection (2)(b),

subsection.continued: shall be deemed to be payment by the superior nominated sub-contractor who has paid the amount by way of contribution or has suffered a deduction from any sum due to him by way of set-off to an employee of wages under section 43G.

section.name: s43K
section.heading: Cessation of employer’s liability for wages paid by principal contractor, superior sub-contractor or superior nominated sub-contractor
section.content: Where any wages are paid to an employee by a principal contractor or superior sub-contractor under section 43C or by a superior nominated sub-contractor under section 43G, the liability of the employer shall, subject to sections 43F(1) and 43J(1), cease.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under section 43D or 43H may be served on a principal contractor or a main nominated sub-contractor respectively and a request under section 43E or 43I may be served on an employer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it to him personally;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by leaving it at his usual address or last known residential or business address; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending it to him by registered post to any address referred to in paragraph (b).

subsection.content: Service under subsection (1)(b) shall be deemed to have been effected on the day on which the notice or request is left at the premises.

section.name: s43M
section.heading: Employee’s rights against employer not affected
section.content: Nothing in this Part shall prejudice the right of an employee to recover any wages due to him by an employer directly from the employer.

part.name: P9B
part.heading: Offence of Employer’s Failure to Pay any Sum Payable under Award of Labour Tribunal or Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board
part.sourceNote: (Part IXB added 9 of 2010 s. 4. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2015)

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: award (判令) includes an order;
registrar (主任), in relation to a tribunal, means the Registrar of the Labour Tribunal or the Registrar of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board (as the case may be);

def.name: SpecifiedEntitlement
def.leadIn: specified entitlement (指明權利) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any wages or any other sum payable under section 23, 24 or 25, or interest payable under section 25A on the wages or sum;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any end of year payment payable under Part IIA;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any maternity leave pay or sum payable under Part III;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: any paternity leave pay payable under Part IIIA; (Added 21 of 2014 s. 15)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any severance payment payable under Part VA;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any long service payment payable under Part VB;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any sickness allowance or sum payable under Part VII;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any holiday pay payable under Part VIII;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any annual leave pay payable under Part VIIIA;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any sum payable in respect of rest days, maternity leave, paternity leave, holiday or annual leave which the employer is required under this Ordinance to grant to an employee but fails to grant, to the extent that the sum is not covered by paragraph (a), (b), (c), (ca), (d), (e), (f), (g) or (h); (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 15)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: any terminal payments payable under section 32O to the extent that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the terminal payments are entitlements referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (ca), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h) or (i) to which an employee is entitled upon the termination of the employee’s contract of employment or, by virtue of section 32O(5), as a consequence of the unreasonable variation of the terms of that contract; or (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 15)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the award of those terminal payments is made by virtue of section 32M(2); (Amended 21 of 2018 s. 9)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: any compensation payable under section 32P; or (Amended 21 of 2018 s. 9)

paragraph.leadIn: any of the following sums payable under an order for reinstatement or re-engagement made under section 32N (as varied under section 32PA or 32PC, if applicable)—

subparagraph.content: the sum mentioned in section 32NA(1)(a)(i), to the extent that the sum would have been awarded as entitlements falling within paragraph (j) if neither an order for reinstatement nor an order for re-engagement had been made;
the sum mentioned in section 32NA(1)(a)(ii);
the sum mentioned in section 32NA(1)(b); (Added 21 of 2018 s. 9)

subsection.def: tribunal (審裁處) means the Labour Tribunal or Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board.

subsection.leadIn: A reference in this Part to an award of a tribunal includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a settlement treated as an award of the Labour Tribunal under section 15(9) of the Labour Tribunal Ordinance (Cap. 25); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a settlement treated as an award of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board under section 14(4) of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board Ordinance (Cap. 453).

subsection.leadIn: A reference in this Part to the date of an award means, in relation to a settlement referred to in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of filing of the settlement in the Labour Tribunal under section 15(8) of the Labour Tribunal Ordinance (Cap. 25); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date of filing of the settlement with the Registrar of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board under section 14(3) of the Minor Employment Claims Adjudication Board Ordinance (Cap. 453).

subsection.content: This Part applies to an award of a tribunal that is made on or after the commencement date.

subsection.def: In this section, *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which the Employment (Amendment) Ordinance 2010 (9 of 2010) comes into operation.

section.name: s43P
section.heading: Offence of employer’s failure to pay any sum payable under award of tribunal

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an award of a tribunal provides, in whole or in part, for the payment by an employer of any specified entitlement (whether or not the specified entitlement is payable only on any condition being met); and (Amended 21 of 2018 s. 10)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the employer wilfully and without reasonable excuse fails to pay—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any sum payable under the award (other than a sum to which subparagraph (ii) applies) within 14 days after the date of the award; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any sum payable under the award that is, by the terms of the award, payable otherwise than on the date of the award, within 14 days after the date on which the sum is, by those terms, payable,

subsection.continued: the employer commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

subsection.leadIn: A reference in subsection (1)(b)(i) or (ii) to any sum payable under an award includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any part of a sum payable under the award; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a sum payable by instalments, any instalment or part of an instalment.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an award of a tribunal provides for the payment of a sum but does not indicate whether or not that sum includes any specified entitlement; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the claim to which the award relates consists, in whole or in part, of any specified entitlement,

subsection.continued: then, unless there is evidence to the contrary, the award is to be treated as providing for the payment of a specified entitlement.

subsection.content: Subsection (5) applies to an award that is an order for reinstatement or re-engagement made under section 32N (as varied under section 32PA or 32PC, if applicable) (which order (as so varied, if applicable) is referred to in subsection (5) as the order). (Added 21 of 2018 s. 10)

Where the order specifies a date (specified payment date) as the date by which the employer must pay to the employee a sum if the employer fails to reinstate or re-engage the employee on the terms specified in the order by the date so specified, the specified payment date is, on that failure, the date on which the sum is, by the terms of the award, payable for the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(ii). (Added 21 of 2018 s. 10)

section.name: s43Q
section.heading: Liability of directors, partners, etc. for offence under section 43P

subsection.content: Where an offence under section 43P committed by a body corporate is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, any director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, the director, manager, secretary or other similar officer commits the like offence.

Where an offence under section 43P committed by a partner in a firm is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, any other partner in the firm or any other person concerned in the management of the firm, the other partner or the other person concerned in the management of the firm commits the like offence.

subsection.leadIn: An offence under section 43P committed by a body corporate is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to the neglect on the part of, any director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the director, manager, secretary or other similar officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was concerned in the management of the body corporate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knew or ought to have known that the award of the tribunal in respect of which the offence was committed had been made against the body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: An offence under section 43P committed by a partner in a firm is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to the neglect on the part of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any other partner in the firm, if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the other partner was concerned in the management of the firm; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other partner in the firm or any other person concerned in the management of the firm, if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the other partner or the other person knew or ought to have known that the award of the tribunal in respect of which the offence was committed had been made against the firm.

subsection.leadIn: The presumption under subsection (3) or (4) is rebutted by a person charged with an offence under section 43P by virtue of that subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue that the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance and was not attributable to the person’s neglect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s43R
section.heading: Proof of certain matters in proceedings for offence under section 43P

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of proceedings for an offence under section 43P, a document (first-mentioned document) purporting to be a copy of a specified document, and purporting to be certified by or on behalf of the registrar of a tribunal or the registrar of a court as a true copy of the specified document, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof and, unless there is evidence to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the court before which the first-mentioned document is produced must presume—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that the first-mentioned document is certified by or on behalf of the registrar of a tribunal or the registrar of a court; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the first-mentioned document is a true copy of the specified document;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of the first-mentioned document purporting to be a copy of a specified document referred to in subsection (2)(a) and prepared by an officer of a tribunal or of a court, the first-mentioned document is evidence of all matters contained in it; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of the first-mentioned document purporting to be a copy of a specified document referred to in subsection (2)(b) and prepared by an officer of a tribunal or of a court, the first-mentioned document is evidence of the facts specified in subsection (4) or (5).

def.name: SpecifiedDocument
def.leadIn: In subsection (1), specified document (指明文件) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a claim filed with a tribunal, or an award made by a tribunal, or any other document relating to proceedings before a tribunal or a court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any document that is relevant to any fact specified in subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of proceedings for an offence under section 43P, a certificate purporting to be issued by or on behalf of the registrar of a tribunal or the registrar of a court and stating any of the facts specified in subsection (4) or (5) is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof and, unless there is evidence to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the court before which the certificate is produced must presume that the certificate is issued by or on behalf of the registrar of a tribunal or the registrar of a court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate is evidence of the facts so stated.

subsection.leadIn: The following facts are specified for the purposes of subsection (3) in relation to a certificate purporting to be issued by or on behalf of the registrar of a tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
