paragraph.content: whether any payment has been made to the tribunal in full or partial discharge of an award of the tribunal and, if so, particulars of the payment (including the date, amount and, in the case of an award made in favour of 2 or more claimants, to which claimant the amount is paid);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether a decision has been made in any proceedings to set aside or review an award of the tribunal and, if so, the particulars of the decision;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether any proceedings are pending to set aside or review an award of the tribunal and, if so, the particulars of the pending proceedings;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.leadIn: for proceedings relating to an award that is an order for reinstatement or order for re-engagement—

paragraph.content: whether a decision has been made in relation to an application made for the purposes of section 32PA or 32PC (if applicable) in respect of the order and, if so, the particulars of the decision; and
whether an application made for the purposes of section 32PA or 32PC (if applicable) in respect of the order is pending and, if so, the particulars of the application; (Added 21 of 2018 s. 11)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether any person was present at the hearing of the tribunal at which an award of the tribunal was made or at any hearing of the claim to which the award relates; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether any document relating to proceedings before the tribunal has been served on any person and, if so, the particulars of service (including the mode, time and address of service).

subsection.leadIn: The following facts are specified for the purposes of subsection (3) in relation to a certificate purporting to be issued by or on behalf of the registrar of a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a decision has been made in an appeal (if any) against an award of a tribunal and, if so, the particulars of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether an appeal is pending against an award of a tribunal and, if so, the particulars of the pending appeal.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: order for re-engagement (再次聘用的命令) means an order for re-engagement made under section 32N and includes such an order as varied under section 32PA or 32PC;
order for reinstatement (復職的命令) means an order for reinstatement made under section 32N and includes such an order as varied under section 32PC;
registrar of a court (司法常務官) means—(a)the Registrar of the High Court; or(b)the Registrar of the Court of Final Appeal. (Replaced 21 of 2018 s. 11)

subsection.content: In subsections (1) and (3), a reference to a court before which a document or a certificate is produced includes a magistrate.
No prosecution for an offence under section 43P may be commenced without the consent in writing of the Commissioner.
Before giving consent to prosecute under subsection (1), the Commissioner must hear the person against whom the allegation is made, or give the person an opportunity of being heard.

Subject to subsection (1), a prosecution for an offence under section 43P may be brought in the name of the Commissioner and may be commenced and conducted by any officer of the Labour Department authorized in that behalf in writing by the Commissioner.
Nothing in this section derogates from the powers of the Secretary for Justice in respect of the prosecution of criminal offences.

part.name: P10
part.heading: Information respecting Conditions of Service
part.sourceNote: (Amended 48 of 1984 s. 24)
(Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2015)

subsection.leadIn: Every employer shall inform each person in detail before such person enters his employment, in a manner intelligible to such person, of the conditions with regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the wages and the wage period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where Part IIA applies to such person, the end of year payment or proportion of the end of year payment and the payment period; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the length of notice required to terminate the proposed contract of employment,

subsection.continued: under which he is to be employed. (Replaced 48 of 1984 s. 25)

subsection.content: Where the contract of employment is not in writing, upon receipt, before such employment is entered into, of a written request therefor from such person the employer shall forthwith deliver to him a notice in writing containing such conditions. (Amended 41 of 1990 s. 19)

Where the contract of employment is in writing, the employer shall provide such person with a copy of the contract immediately after it is signed or immediately after the procedure to validate the contract is completed where such procedure is required. (Added 41 of 1990 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: Every employer shall inform his employee, in a manner intelligible to the employee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whenever any change takes place in the conditions referred to in section 44 or the conditions in force at any time, of such change;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time of each payment to him of his wages, in so far as such particulars may be subject to change, of the particulars of his wages for the wage period concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Where there is no written amendment to a contract of employment, upon receipt of a written request from his employee the employer shall deliver to him— (Amended 41 of 1990 s. 20)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the request relates to changes in the conditions referred to in subsection (1)(a), forthwith; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where it relates to the particulars referred to in subsection (1)(b), at the time of the payment to him of his wages for the wage period concerned,

subsection.continued: a notice in writing containing such changes in conditions or particulars, as the case may be.

subsection.content: Where there is any written amendment made to a contract of employment, the employer shall provide his employee with a copy of the written amendment immediately after the amendment is reduced to writing or immediately after the procedure to validate the amendment is completed where such procedure is required. (Added 41 of 1990 s. 20)

section.name: s46
section.heading: Details of conditions and particulars of wages

subsection.content: The conditions referred to in sections 44 and 45 shall include the rate of wages, the overtime rate and any allowances, whether calculated by the piece, job, hour, day, week or otherwise, of the person or employee concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars referred to in section 45 shall include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: particulars of the amount earned, including overtime earnings (if any), by the employee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars of any deductions made from the wages of the employee and the reasons therefor.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Records, Forms and Returns
part.sourceNote: (Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2015)

section.name: s47
section.heading: Records to be kept by employers

subsection.leadIn: Every employer who is a member of a class specified under subsection (2) shall in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each of his employees; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any class of them,

subsection.continued: keep records in such form as may be specified to enable him to comply with Part X.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1), the Commissioner may, by notice in the Gazette, specify any class of employers.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Returns to be made to Commissioner

content.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, the Commissioner may, either by notice in writing served by registered post or by notice in the Gazette, require any employer or class of employers to make returns in such form and at such times as he may in any such notice direct:
content.proviso: Provided that the Commissioner shall not require in any return information or particulars in respect of a time or period more than 6 months immediately preceding the date of the notice.

subsection.content: Copies of any such form shall be supplied to an employer free of charge on application to the Commissioner.
The Commissioner may specify the form of any consent, request, notice in writing, certificate, application, record or return required for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Amended 52 of 1988 s. 15)
The Commissioner may publish in the Gazette any forms specified by him under subsection (1).

section.name: s49A
section.heading: Requirement to keep wage and employment records

subsection.content: Every employer shall at all times keep and maintain a record in which is set out the wage and employment history of each employee covering the period of his employment during the preceding 12 months. (Amended L.N. 34 of 1990; 7 of 2007 s. 16)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), an employer who engages a specified employee must at all times keep and maintain a record covering the specified period of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the wages paid to the employee in respect of each wage period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employee’s wage period. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: The wage records referred to in subsection (1) or (1A) shall be kept— (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 17)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the employer’s place of business or at the place where the employee is employed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a period of 6 months after the employee ceases to be employed.

subsection.leadIn: A record which includes particulars in relation to each employee of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his name and identity card number;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date he commenced his employment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: his job title;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the wages paid to him in respect of each wage period;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: his wage period;

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: if the employee is an employee within the meaning of the Minimum Wage Ordinance (Cap. 608) and the wages payable to the employee in respect of any wage period are less than the amount specified in the Ninth Schedule (or the amount that bears the same ratio to that amount as the length of that wage period bears to the month in which that wage period falls, calculated where that wage period falls in more than one month according to the number of days of that wage period falling in each particular month), the total number of hours (including any part of an hour) that are hours worked by the employee in that wage period; (Added 15 of 2010 s. 20)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: periods of annual leave, sick leave, maternity leave, paternity leave and holidays— (Amended 21 of 2014 s. 16)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to which he is entitled; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that he has taken together with details of payments made in respect of such period;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the amount of any end of year payment payable under Part IIA and the period to which it relates;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the period of notice required for termination of contract;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the date of any termination of employment,

subsection.continued: shall be a sufficient record for the purposes of subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3), subsection (1) must also be taken to require an employer to keep—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an employee to whom the Minimum Wage Ordinance (Cap. 608) does not apply because of section 7(4) of that Ordinance, a document (or copy of a document) issued by an institution showing that the period of work is arranged or endorsed by the institution in connection with a programme being provided by the institution to the employee that is of a kind covered by the definition of student intern in section 2 of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an employee to whom the Minimum Wage Ordinance (Cap. 608) does not apply because of section 7(5) of that Ordinance, the statutory declaration (or a copy of the statutory declaration) provided by the employee under section 3(b) of that Ordinance and a document (or copy of a document) issued by an institution showing that the employee is at the commencement of the employment enrolled in a programme being provided by the institution that is of a kind covered by the definition of work experience student in section 2 of that Ordinance. (Added 15 of 2010 s. 20)

subsection.content: Nothing in subsection (1) requires an employer to set out in a record particulars of a kind referred to in subsection (3)(ea) for any wage period, or part of a wage period, of an employee that occurred before the effective date of the hourly wage rate first specified in column 1 of Schedule 3 to the Minimum Wage Ordinance (Cap. 608) on or after the commencement* of section 16 of that Ordinance. (Added 15 of 2010 s. 20)
The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend the Ninth Schedule. (Added 15 of 2010 s. 20)

subsection.def: For the purposes of subsections (3)(ea) and (5), hours worked (工作時數), wage period (工資期) and wages (工資) have the same respective meanings as in the Minimum Wage Ordinance (Cap. 608). (Added 15 of 2010 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1A)—

def.name: SpecifiedPeriod
def.leadIn: specified period (指明期間), in relation to a specified employee, means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: if the employee’s pre-transition employment period is less than 12 months—

subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of a monthly rated employee—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: if the employee’s pre-transition employment period covers not less than a month—that employment period; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the employee’s pre-transition employment period covers less than a month—the first month of the employee’s whole employment period; or

subparagraph.name: A
B
subparagraph.content: if the employee’s pre-transition employment period covers less than 30 normal working days—the period covering the employee’s first 30 normal working days in the employee’s whole employment period. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 17)

subsection.leadIn: In the definition of specified period in subsection (8)—
subsection.def: whole employment period (整段僱傭期) has the meaning given by section 1(1) of Schedule 11. (Added 4 of 2022 s. 17)

part.name: P12
part.heading: Employment Agencies
part.sourceNote: (Part XII replaced 35 of 1973 s. 2. Format changes—E.R. 3 of 2017)

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Associate
def.leadIn: associate (相關人士), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a company—

subparagraph.content: a related person of the person; or
an individual employed by the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a partner in a partnership—

subparagraph.content: a related person of the person; or
an individual employed by the person or by the partnership; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case—an individual employed by the person; (Added 8 of 2018 s. 3)

subsection.def: certificate of exemption (豁免證明書) means a certificate issued under section 54;

def.name: EmploymentAgency
def.leadIn: employment agency (職業介紹所) means a person who operates a business the purpose of which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to obtain employment for another person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to supply the labour of another person to an employer,

def.continued: whether or not the person who operates the business will derive any pecuniary or other material advantage from either the employer or such other person; (Amended 41 of 1990 s. 21)

subsection.def: licence (牌照) means a licence issued under section 52 and licensee (持牌人) shall be construed accordingly; (Amended 8 of 2018 s. 3)

def.name: RelatedPerson
def.leadIn: related person (有關連人士) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a company—a director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a partner in a partnership—

subparagraph.content: another partner in the partnership; or
another person concerned in the management of the partnership. (Added 8 of 2018 s. 3)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), this Part shall apply to any employment agency which is carried on in Hong Kong, whether the employment is to take place within or outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This Part shall not apply to any employment agency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is carried on or subvented by the Central People’s Government or the Government; (Amended 31 of 2025 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is carried on under the terms of a permit to maintain a crew department granted or deemed to be granted under the Merchant Shipping (Seafarers) Ordinance (Cap. 478); (Amended 44 of 1995 s. 143)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: which is carried on by an employer for the sole purpose of recruiting persons for employment on his own behalf;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: which is carried on by a contractor, or sub-contractor, who employs any person on work for another person;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: which is carried on by the proprietor of a newspaper or other publication if the operation of an employment agency is non-profit making and is not the principal purpose of the publication of the newspaper or other publication;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: which is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: non-profit making;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: wholly maintained or managed by the owner, staff or students of a school, college, university or other educational institution recognized by the Permanent Secretary for Education; and (Amended 3 of 2003 s. 41; L.N. 130 of 2007)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: carried on solely for or in connection with the employment of the students or graduates of such school, college, university or other educational institution; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: subject to any regulations which may be applicable thereto, in respect of which a certificate of exemption has been issued.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Prohibitions in respect of the operation of employment agencies

subsection.leadIn: A person must not operate, manage or assist in the management of an employment agency unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is the holder of a licence or certificate of exemption issued in respect of the employment agency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is an associate of the holder. (Replaced 8 of 2018 s. 4)

subsection.content: No person shall operate, manage or assist in the management of an employment agency at any place other than the place of business specified in the licence or certificate of exemption issued in respect of the employment agency.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Application for and issue of licences

subsection.content: The Commissioner may issue a licence to operate an employment agency to any person who applies therefor in such manner as may be prescribed.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Where the applicant for a licence is a company, the application shall be submitted by a director of the company on its behalf. (Added 28 of 1992 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: A licence issued under this section shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form determined by the Commissioner; and (Replaced 28 of 1992 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the place of business of the employment agency in respect of which it is issued. (Amended 28 of 1992 s. 3)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A licensee shall cause his licence to be displayed at all times in a conspicuous position at his place of business. (Added 28 of 1992 s. 3)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.content: Where a licensee operates an employment agency at more than one place of business, he shall designate which place of business is the main location and shall obtain a duplicate licence for each branch location and cause the duplicate licence to be displayed at all times in a conspicuous position at the branch location. (Added 28 of 1992 s. 3)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.content: Where a licensee operates an employment agency at more than one location using different names, the agencies shall be deemed to be separate entities and he shall obtain a separate licence for each name used. (Added 28 of 1992 s. 3)
Subject to section 53, a licence issued under subsection (1) shall be valid for 12 months after the date on which it is issued.
The Commissioner may, upon application in such manner as may be prescribed, renew a licence issued under subsection (1).

section.name: s53
section.heading: Refusal to issue, or revocation of, licences

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may refuse to issue or renew a licence, or may revoke a licence, if he is satisfied on reasonable grounds—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that the name under which the employment agency is operated or is intended to be operated—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is identical with the name of another employment agency which is being, or has been, carried on by another person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: so nearly resembles the name of another employment agency as to be likely to deceive the public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the employment agency is being, or is likely to be, used for unlawful or immoral purposes; (Amended 8 of 2018 s. 5)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the licensee or the person intending to be the licensee— (Amended 8 of 2018 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is an undischarged bankrupt;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
iv
4a
subparagraph.content: has not complied with a code of practice issued under section 62A(1); or (Added 8 of 2018 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: is not, for any other reason, a fit and proper person to operate an employment agency; (Amended 8 of 2018 s. 5)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: (if the licensee or the person intending to be the licensee is a company or a partner in a partnership) that a related person of the licensee or person—

subparagraph.content: has contravened any provision of this Part or any regulation made under section 62; or
has not complied with a code of practice issued under section 62A(1); or (Added 8 of 2018 s. 5)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: that an individual employed by the licensee or by the person intending to be the licensee—

subparagraph.content: has contravened any provision of this Part or any regulation made under section 62; or
has not complied with a code of practice issued under section 62A(1). (Added 8 of 2018 s. 5)

subsection.content: The Commissioner shall, if he refuses to issue or renew a licence or revokes a licence, within 14 days after such refusal or revocation, notify the applicant or licensee in writing of the grounds for such refusal or revocation.

Any person aggrieved by a decision of the Commissioner taken in respect of him under subsection (1) may, within 28 days after he is notified under subsection (2), appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board. (Replaced 6 of 1994 s. 35)

subsection.leadIn: The licensee shall, if the Commissioner refuses to renew or revokes his licence under subsection (1),—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 28 days after he is notified under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if he has appealed under subsection (3), within 14 days after he withdraws or abandons the appeal or he is notified of the Administrative Appeals Board’s dismissal of the appeal,

subsection.continued: deliver the licence, and every copy thereof, to the Commissioner. (Replaced 6 of 1994 s. 35)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Commissioner may, upon application in such manner as may be prescribed, exempt an employment agency from obtaining a licence under section 52, subject to such conditions as he may specify, if he is satisfied that the employment agency is non-profit making and should, in the public interest, be so exempted.
The Commissioner shall issue to any person exempted under subsection (1) a certificate of exemption.

subsection.leadIn: A certificate of exemption issued under subsection (3) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in a form determined by the Commissioner; (Replaced 28 of 1992 s. 4)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the place of business of the employment agency in respect of which it is issued; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify any conditions subject to which it is issued.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may, at any time, withdraw an exemption granted under section 54 if he is satisfied that the employment agency has ceased to be non-profit making or should not be so exempted in the public interest.

Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (1), the grounds on which the Commissioner may withdraw an exemption shall include mutatis mutandis the grounds contained in section 53(1) on which he may refuse to issue or renew a licence or revoke a licence.
Where the Commissioner withdraws his exemption from any person under subsection (1) he shall notify such person in writing of the grounds for such withdrawal.

The holder of a certificate of exemption shall, within 14 days after he is notified under subsection (3) of the withdrawal of the Commissioner’s exemption, deliver the certificate of exemption, and every copy thereof, to the Commissioner.
No appeal shall lie under this Part against the decision of the Commissioner to withdraw an exemption granted to an employment agency.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Maintenance and delivery to the Commissioner of prescribed registers, records and returns

subsection.leadIn: A licensee shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: maintain a record of—

subparagraph.content: all job applicants registered with his employment agency; and
job applicants who, at the time of registration, were not residents of Hong Kong and who were placed in employment in Hong Kong by his employment agency,

paragraph.continued: containing the person’s name, address, Hong Kong Identity Card number or, in the case of a non-resident, passport number and citizenship, fee and commission received, date of employment and name and address of employer; and (Replaced 28 of 1992 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: keep such records available for inspection at the place of business of the employment agency by the Commissioner, or by any public officer authorized by him in that behalf, at all reasonable times. (Amended 28 of 1992 s. 5)

subsection.content: A licensee shall, within such time as may be prescribed, deliver to the Commissioner such returns in respect of the employment agency as may be prescribed.

The records referred to in subsection (1) shall be retained by the licensee for a period of not less than 12 months after the expiration of each accounting year of the employment agency concerned. (Amended 28 of 1992 s. 5)

section.name: s57
section.heading: Prohibited acts in respect of employment agencies

subsection.leadIn: A licensee, or an associate of a licensee, in respect of an employment agency, or a person purporting to act as such a licensee or associate, must not, directly or indirectly— (Amended 8 of 2018 s. 6)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: receive from any person on account of having obtained, or in connection with obtaining or seeking to obtain, employment for that person—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any reward of any kind; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any payment or other advantage in respect of expenses or otherwise, except the prescribed commission; (Replaced 87 of 1975 s. 2. Amended 28 of 1992 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: share with any person, other than another licensee or a bona fide partner or shareholder in the employment agency, the prescribed commission; or (Amended 87 of 1975 s. 2; 28 of 1992 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: enter, except with the written permission of the Commissioner, into an agreement, express or implied, with any employer whereby—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the employer undertakes to employ only persons who seek employment through the employment agency; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the employment agency agrees to pay or give to the employer some form of material benefit. (Amended 8 of 2018 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed commission (訂明佣金), in relation to an employment agency, means the commission that the employment agency is permitted to charge and receive as prescribed by a regulation made under section 62. (Added 8 of 2018 s. 6)

section.name: s58
section.heading: Inspection of places of business of licensed or exempted employment agencies
section.leadIn: The Commissioner, and any public officer authorized by him in that behalf may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter and inspect without a warrant at any reasonable time the place of business of an employment agency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the production of, inspect, examine or take copies of any record or other document relating to an employment agency; (Amended 28 of 1992 s. 7)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require any person who operates, manages or assists in the management of an employment agency to furnish such information or particulars relating to the employment agency as he may specify; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: make such other inquiries from any other person connected or associated with the employment agency as he thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner, any public officer authorized by him in that behalf or any police officer not below the rank of inspector suspects on reasonable grounds that there is in any premises or place evidence of an offence under this Part he may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter and search without a warrant any such premises (other than domestic premises) at any reasonable time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the production of, seize, detain and remove any article, record or other document which may be evidence of an offence under this Part. (Amended 28 of 1992 s. 7)

subsection.content: A magistrate may, if he is satisfied by information on oath that there may be found in any domestic premises any evidence of an offence under this Part, issue a warrant authorizing the Commissioner, any public officer authorized in that behalf by the Commissioner or any police officer not below the rank of inspector to enter and search the domestic premises at any reasonable time.
Any person who contravenes section 51(2) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 28 of 1992 s. 8)
Any person who contravenes section 53(5) or 55(4) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2)

Any licensee who contravenes section 52(2A), (2B) or (2C) or 56(1), (2) or (3) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 3. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 28 of 1992 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in connection with any application to the Commissioner under section 52(1) or 54(1) furnishes any information which he knows or reasonably ought to know to be false or misleading in any material particular; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in connection with any inquiry or inspection under section 58—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: fails without reasonable excuse to produce any record or other document relating to the employment agency when required to do so by the Commissioner or any public officer authorized in that behalf by the Commissioner; or (Amended 28 of 1992 s. 7)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: furnishes to the Commissioner or any such public officer any information which he knows or reasonably ought to know to be false or misleading in any material particular,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2)

subsection.content: A person who contravenes section 51(1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years. (Replaced 8 of 2018 s. 7)
A person who contravenes section 57(1)(a) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years. (Replaced 8 of 2018 s. 7)

Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), a complaint may be made or an information laid in respect of an offence under subsection (6) or (7) within 12 months after the date of the commission of the offence. (Added 8 of 2018 s. 7)
A person who contravenes section 57(1)(b) or (c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Added 8 of 2018 s. 7)

section.name: s61
section.heading: Application of sections 52(2A), (2B) and (2C), 56, 57, 58 and 59 to holders of certificates of exemption and exempted employment agencies

subsection.content: Sections 52(2A), (2B) and (2C), 56, 57, 58 and 59 shall apply to holders of certificates of exemption in the same manner as they apply to licensees.

Every reference to an employment agency in sections 52(2A), (2B) and (2C), 56, 57, 58 and 59 shall, except where the context otherwise requires, be construed as a reference to both an employment agency licensed under section 52 and an employment agency exempted under section 54.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Power to make regulations
section.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations for all or any of the following purposes— (Amended 56 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribing the procedure for the issue of licences and certificates of exemption;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fixing the fees to be paid for the issue and renewal of a licence or certificate of exemption and the method of payment of such fees;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: prescribing the procedure to be followed when a licensee or holder of a certificate of exemption—

subparagraph.content: ceases to operate his employment agency; or
changes the place of business of his employment agency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: prescribing the procedure to be followed when—

subparagraph.content: a company is issued with a licence or certificate of exemption; and
there is a change in the management of the company;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: providing for the publication in the Gazette of particulars of all licences and certificates of exemption;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: prescribing the nature of services in respect of which an employment agency may charge and receive any fee, commission or expenses;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: prescribing the maximum fees and charges which may be charged and received by an employment agency;
prescribing any thing which is to be or may be prescribed under this Part; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: generally for the better carrying out of the provisions and purposes of this Part.

section.name: s62A
section.heading: Codes of practice for employment agencies

subsection.content: The Commissioner may issue codes of practice setting out principles, procedures, guidelines and standards for the operation, management or control of employment agencies.
The Commissioner is to make a copy of every code of practice available for inspection by the public free of charge during business hours at offices of the Government directed by the Commissioner.

part.name: P13
part.heading: Offences and Penalties
part.sourceNote: (Format changes— E.R. 3 of 2017)

subsection.content: Any employer who wilfully and without reasonable excuse contravenes any of the provisions of section 11E or 11F(3) or (4) shall be guilty of an offence. (Amended 71 of 1970 s. 4; 48 of 1984 s. 26; 24 of 1988 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: Any employer who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: without reasonable excuse, fails—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to grant to any employee any rest day which he is required to grant under Part IV; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes section 19,

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence. (Added 23 of 1970 s. 4)

subsection.content: Any person who wilfully contravenes section 67(2) shall be guilty of an offence. (Added 71 of 1970 s. 4)

subsection.leadIn: Any employer who without reasonable excuse fails—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to grant to any employee any holiday which he is required to grant under section 39; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to pay to any employee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any sickness allowance which he is required to pay under section 33; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any holiday pay which he is required to pay under section 40 or 40A(2); or (Amended 48 of 1984 s. 26)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to give to any employee any leave which he is required to grant or allow by section 41AA or 41F(3); or (Replaced 53 of 1990 s. 5)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to grant to any employee any rest day or holiday which he is required to grant under section 41AA(6); or (Amended 53 of 1990 s. 5)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: to pay to an employee—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pay as regards leave which he is required to grant or allow under section 41AA or 41F(3); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a sum or compensation which he is required to pay under section 41D, (Replaced 53 of 1990 s. 5)

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence. (Added 39 of 1973 s. 6. Amended 53 of 1977 s. 7)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes section 40A(1) or 41B shall be guilty of an offence. (Replaced 103 of 1995 s. 19)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.leadIn: Any person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with a requirement made by any officer under any of the provisions of section 72 other than subsection (1)(a), (b) and (c) of that section; (Amended 31 of 1992 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wilfully or recklessly gives information which is false in a material particular or withholds information as to any of the matters in respect of which information is required to be given under any of the provisions of section 72 other than subsection (1)(b) and (c) of that section; or (Amended 31 of 1992 s. 2)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: fails to comply with any condition imposed on the granting of any exemption under section 73(2),

subsection.continued: shall be guilty of an offence. (Added 55 of 1979 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Any person who makes a payment in contravention of section 41E(1) shall be guilty of an offence.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: In any proceedings for an offence under this subsection the onus shall be on the defendant to show that any payment to which the offence relates was made pursuant to an agreement duly made under section 41E(2). (Added 53 of 1990 s. 5)

subsection.name: 5C
subsection.content: Any employer who contravenes section 41EA shall be guilty of an offence. (Added 53 of 1990 s. 5)
Any person who fails to comply with the requirements of a notice in writing or a notice published in the Gazette under section 48(1) shall be guilty of an offence.
A person who is guilty of an offence under this section shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Amended 24 of 1988 s. 2; 103 of 1995 s. 19)

section.name: s63A
section.heading: Offences relating to sections 31, 72A and 72B and penalty

subsection.content: Any employer who wilfully and without reasonable excuse contravenes any of the provisions of section 31 shall be guilty of an offence. (Amended 31 of 1992 s. 3)
A person who is guilty of an offence under subsection (1) shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 6. (Replaced 103 of 1995 s. 20)
Any person who contravenes section 72A(3) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 5. (Added 103 of 1995 s. 20)
Any person who contravenes any of the provisions of section 72B(1)(a), (b), (c) or (d) shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 6. (Added 103 of 1995 s. 20)

section.name: s63B
section.heading: Offences relating to sections 32 and 72(1)(a), (b) and (c)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes section 32 or fails to comply with a requirement made by an officer under section 72(1)(a), (b) or (c) commits an offence.

Any person who wilfully or recklessly gives information which is false in a material particular or withholds information as to any of the matters in respect of which information is required to be given under section 72(1)(b) or (c) commits an offence.
A person who commits an offence under this section is liable to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 1 year. (Amended 103 of 1995 s. 21)

section.name: s63C
section.heading: Offences relating to time and payment of wages
section.content: Any employer who wilfully and without reasonable excuse contravenes section 23, 24 or 25 commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $350,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

section.name: s63CA
section.heading: Offences relating to interest on late payment of wages
section.content: Any employer who wilfully and without reasonable excuse contravenes section 25A commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3.

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes section 18(2), 26, 27, 28(2), 29, 30, 41AA(4) or (5), 41F(1), 41G, 44, 45, 47(1), 49A or 72A(1) or (2) shall be guilty of an offence.
A person who is guilty of an offence under this section is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

No prosecution for an offence under section 31RA(6) or section 63(1) or (3) or 63A(1) or 63B or 63C shall be commenced without the consent in writing of the Commissioner. (Amended 71 of 1970 s. 4A; 24 of 1988 s. 2; 52 of 1988 s. 16; 31 of 1992 s. 5)
Before the Commissioner gives his consent to prosecute under subsection (1) he shall hear the person against whom the allegation is made, or give him an opportunity of being heard.

Subject to subsection (1), a prosecution for any offence under this Ordinance may be brought in the name of the Commissioner and may be commenced and conducted by any officer of the Labour Department authorized in that behalf in writing by the Commissioner. (Replaced 48 of 1984 s. 27)
Nothing in this section shall derogate from the powers of the Secretary for Justice in respect of the prosecution of criminal offences. (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

Any summons relating to an offence alleged to have been committed under this Ordinance by an employer may be served by leaving a copy of the summons with some person for him at the place of employment mentioned in the summons.
Any such summons may be addressed to “the employer” without specifying the name of the employer.

Any summons relating to an offence alleged to have been committed under this Ordinance by an employee may be served by leaving a copy of the summons either with some person for him at his last or usual place of abode or with some person for him at his place of employment mentioned in the summons.

Any summons relating to an offence alleged to have been committed under this Ordinance by a company may be served by leaving a copy of the summons at, or sending it by registered post to, the registered office of the company.

Where an offence under section 63B or 63C committed by a body corporate is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, any director, manager, secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate, the director, manager, secretary or other similar officer shall be guilty of the like offence.

Where an offence under section 63B or 63C committed by a partner in a firm is proved to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of, any other partner in the firm or any person concerned in the management of the firm, that partner or the person concerned in the management of the firm shall be guilty of the like offence.

An employer convicted of an offence under this Ordinance shall, in addition to any fine imposed under this Ordinance, if the court before which the conviction was obtained so orders, pay any wages or other sum outstanding at the time of the conviction and in respect of which the offence was committed.

Where the employer is acquitted of an offence under this Ordinance on grounds that his default was not wilful or not without reasonable excuse, the court may, if it finds that any wages or other sums in respect of which the charge was brought are due, order the employer to pay such wages or other sums.

part.name: P14
part.heading: Miscellaneous
part.sourceNote: (Format changes— E.R. 3 of 2017)

section.name: s66
section.heading: Wages not to be attached
section.leadIn: No order for the attachment of wages, or, in the case of an employee to whom Part IIA applies, any end of year payment or proportion thereof, of an employee shall be made by any court:
section.proviso: Provided that a civil debt due to the Government under any enactment may be recovered from the wages of an employee by attachment or otherwise.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Application for apprehension of absconding employer

subsection.leadIn: If an employer or former employer is about to leave Hong Kong with intent to evade payment of— (Amended 48 of 1984 s. 30)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any wages earned by any of his employees and owed by the employer, whether or not the payment of such wages is yet due; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other moneys owed by the employer under a contract of employment to any of his employees,

subsection.continued: any of his employees may apply to a District Judge to issue a warrant in accordance with the Second Schedule, and in respect of any such application the Second Schedule shall apply.

subsection.content: No person shall make an application under subsection (1) unless he has reasonable grounds for making such application.

section.name: s67A
section.heading: Amendment of limitation imposed on severance payment and long service payment
section.leadIn: The Legislative Council may, by resolution published in the Gazette, amend the references to $22,500 in— (Amended 4 of 2022 s. 18)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 31G and 31V (including those sections as modified by Schedule 11);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: this section; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sections 7 and 8 of Schedule 2 to the Protection of Wages on Insolvency Ordinance (Cap. 380),

section.continued: by substituting a different amount specified in the resolution.
section.sourceNote: (Replaced 41 of 1990 s. 22. Amended L.N. 264 of 1995; 4 of 2022 s. 18)

section.name: s68
section.heading: Amendment of forms
section.text: The Chief Executive may, by order published in the Gazette, amend Part II of the Second Schedule.

section.name: s68A
section.heading: Commissioner may amend Schedule 12
section.content: The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 12.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Saving as to existing contracts of service
section.leadIn: Save as is otherwise provided in this section, any agreement or contract of employment entered into between an employer and an employee, which is valid and in force at the commencement of this Ordinance, shall continue to be in force and, subject to any express conditions contained in any such agreement or contract, the parties thereto shall be subject to and entitled to the benefit of the provisions of this Ordinance:
section.proviso: Provided that where any express condition in the agreement or contract is contrary to the provisions of this Ordinance, the express condition shall be void.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Contracting out
section.content: Any term of a contract of employment which purports to extinguish or reduce any right, benefit or protection conferred upon the employee by this Ordinance shall be void.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Saving as to schemes of medical treatment under repealed Industrial Employment (Holidays with Pay and Sickness Allowance) Ordinance
section.content: Any scheme of medical treatment which is operated by an employer and is recognized by the Director under section 8 of the repealed Industrial Employment (Holidays with Pay and Sickness Allowance) Ordinance* shall continue in force and have effect as if it were operated and approved under the corresponding provision in this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner, or any public officer authorized by the Commissioner in writing for the purpose and on production of that authority, may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (2), enter, inspect and examine at all reasonable times, by day and night, any premises or place, in which he knows or has reasonable cause to believe that persons are employed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the production of any register, record, form or other document required to be kept under this Ordinance (and, in the case of a record which includes particulars required to be included under section 49A(3)(ea), require that the particulars under section 49A(3)(a), (d), (e), (ea) and (f) are produced in a single document) and inspect, examine and copy the same; (Amended 15 of 2010 s. 21)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make such examination and inquiry as may be necessary to ascertain whether the requirements of this Ordinance are complied with, and seize anything which may appear to be evidence of an offence against this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: examine, either alone or in the presence of any other person, as he thinks fit, respecting matters under this Ordinance, any person whom he finds in any industrial undertaking within the meaning of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59), or whom he has reasonable cause to believe has been within the preceding 2 months employed in any industrial undertaking within the meaning of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59), or require any such person to be so examined and to sign a declaration of the truth of the matters respecting which he has been so examined; (Added 10 of 1980 s. 6)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: require any person who employs or has employed any young person or child in an industrial undertaking within the meaning of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59) or any agent or servant of any such employer to give to him all information in the possession of such person, agent or servant with reference to such young person or child and to the labour conditions and treatment of every young person or child employed by such employer; (Added 10 of 1980 s. 6. Amended 7 of 2001 s. 10)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: require the posting up, in such place and manner and for such period as he may direct, of any notice or form in connection with the provisions of this Ordinance or of any Ordinance specified in the Fourth Schedule; (Added 10 of 1980 s. 6. Amended 48 of 1984 s. 31)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: exercise any other powers which may be conferred on him by any regulations made under this Ordinance. (Added 10 of 1980 s. 6)

subsection.content: No premises or part of a premises which is used for dwelling purposes shall be entered under subsection (1) except by virtue of a warrant issued by a magistrate, where such magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that there is reasonable ground for suspecting that an offence against this Ordinance has been, is being or is about to be committed in such premises or part or that there is in such premises or part anything likely to be or contain evidence of such offence.

An officer exercising any power conferred on him by subsection (1) in relation to any industrial undertaking within the meaning of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59) may take with him any person whom he may reasonably need to assist him in carrying out his duties under this Ordinance and in particular may, for his assistance, take persons who have been engaged by the Commissioner, on account of their special expertise, to advise the Labour Department on any matters necessary for carrying out the purposes of this Ordinance. (Added 10 of 1980 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: A person who accompanies an officer pursuant to subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may give to the officer such assistance in the exercise of any power conferred on him by subsection (1) as the officer may reasonably require;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be deemed to be a public officer for the purposes of sections 72A and 72B. (Added 10 of 1980 s. 6)

section.name: s72A
section.heading: Duty of public officers not to disclose source of complaint, etc.

subsection.content: Save with the consent of the person who has made the complaint or as provided in subsection (4), no public officer shall disclose to any person, other than another public officer in the course of official duty, the name or identity of any person who has made a complaint alleging a contravention of this Ordinance or as a result of which a contravention of this Ordinance has come to his notice or to the notice of any other public officer.

No public officer shall disclose to an employer or his agent or servant that a visit to the place of employment maintained by that employer was made in consequence of the receipt of any such complaint as is referred to in subsection (1).

Save as provided in subsection (4), where, arising out of, or in connection with, the enforcement of this Ordinance, any manufacturing or commercial secret or any working process comes to the knowledge of a public officer, such officer shall not at any time, and notwithstanding that he is no longer a public officer, disclose such secret or process to any person.

Where in any proceedings a court or a magistrate considers that justice so requires, the court may order the disclosure of the name or identity of any person who has made any such complaint as is referred to in subsection (1) or the disclosure of any such secret or process as is referred to in subsection (3).

section.name: s72B
section.heading: Employment not to be terminated, etc. by reason of fact that employee has given evidence in proceedings under Ordinance, etc.

subsection.leadIn: No employer shall terminate, or threaten to terminate, the employment of, or in any way discriminate against, any of his employees by reason of the fact that the employee has— (Amended 61 of 1993 s. 9)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given evidence, or agreed to give evidence, in any proceeding for the enforcement of this Ordinance; (Amended 29 of 1992 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: given information to a public officer in any inquiry made by such officer for the purposes of or in connection with the enforcement of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: given evidence, or agreed to give evidence, in any proceeding relating to an accident to an employee arising out of and in the course of his employment or for the breach of a statutory duty in relation to the safety of persons at work; or (Added 29 of 1992 s. 3)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: given information to a public officer in any inquiry made by such officer for the purposes of or in connection with an accident to an employee arising out of and in the course of his employment or for the breach of a statutory duty in relation to the safety of persons at work. (Added 29 of 1992 s. 3)

subsection.content: Where an employer is convicted of an offence under section 63A(5) in respect of an action prohibited by this section, the court or magistrate before which the conviction is obtained may, in addition to any fine that may be imposed, order the employer to pay as compensation to the employee who was the victim of the offence, such amount as the court or magistrate considers appropriate having regard to the circumstances of the case. (Added 61 of 1993 s. 9. Amended 103 of 1995 s. 23)

section.name: s72C
section.heading: Presumptions
section.leadIn: In any prosecution under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the age of any person at any time is material for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance, his age at the material time shall be deemed to be or have been that which appears to the court or magistrate, after considering any available evidence, to be or to have been his age at that time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the charge alleges the contravention of any of the provisions of this Ordinance prohibiting or controlling the employment of young persons or children and the defendant in such prosecution is the employer at the place of employment in or in respect of which the offence is alleged to have been committed, it shall, until the contrary is proved, be presumed that any young person or child to whom the charge relates and who was employed in the place of employment on the day on which the offence is alleged to have been committed was employed therein on that day by such employer. (Amended 7 of 2001 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations for all or any of the following purposes— (Amended 56 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibiting or controlling the employment of persons or any class of persons in any industry, occupation or trade;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: requiring records to be kept and forms to be maintained in respect of employees or any class of employees employed in any industry, occupation or trade;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: imposing obligations for securing compliance with the provisions of this Ordinance upon employers, their agents or servants, and upon employees;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: imposing duties and liabilities on employers and employees;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: defining the functions, duties and powers of public officers appointed or authorized for the purposes of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: exempting any industry, occupation or trade, or any class or part of any industry, occupation or trade, from the operation of this Ordinance or any provision thereof;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: providing that this Ordinance or any provision thereof shall not apply, or may be modified, in relation to any class of persons;

paragraph.name: ha
paragraph.content: providing that, where the Commissioner is satisfied that work in any industrial undertaking within the meaning of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59), or class or description thereof, is subject to seasonal or other special pressure, he may by order published in the Gazette as respects any such industrial undertaking, or class or description thereof, increase for any employee during any period of such pressure the hours of work or period of employment specified in relation to that employee in regulations made under this Ordinance for a period in any year not exceeding that specified in the order; (Added 10 of 1980 s. 8. Amended 7 of 2001 s. 12)

paragraph.name: hb
paragraph.leadIn: providing that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any document purporting to be a copy of any document or notice and purporting to be signed by a person or his duly authorized agent shall be admitted in evidence in proceedings before any court or magistrate on its production by a public officer without further proof; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: until the contrary is proved, the court or magistrate before which such document is produced shall presume that the document is a true copy and that it is signed by that person or his duly authorized agent; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the document shall be conclusive evidence of the facts stated therein; (Added 10 of 1980 s. 8)

paragraph.name: hc
paragraph.content: providing that any person who works in any place of employment at any kind of work whatsoever incidental to or connected with the process, trade or business for which the place of employment is used shall, save as may be provided otherwise in the regulations, be deemed to be employed therein for the purposes of any regulations made under this Ordinance or of any proceedings thereunder; (Added 10 of 1980 s. 8)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: generally, carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may in writing, in such cases as he thinks fit and for such period and subject to such conditions as he may specify, exempt any person or class of persons from any regulations made under this section.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Penalty for contravention of regulations
section.content: Regulations under this Ordinance may provide that a contravention thereof shall be an offence and may provide penalties therefor not exceeding a fine at level 6.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Transitionals for Certification for Employee Benefits (Chinese Medicine) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2006

subsection.leadIn: A reference in this Ordinance to a certificate or medical certificate issued by a registered Chinese medicine practitioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not include a certificate or medical certificate so issued before the commencement＊ of the 2006 Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not include a certificate or medical certificate so issued on or after the commencement of the 2006 Ordinance to the extent—

subparagraph.content: that it relates to any period of days or hours which ends before that commencement; or
if it relates to any period of days or hours which occurs partly before that commencement, that it relates to such part of the period occurring before that commencement.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: 2006 Ordinance (《2006年條例》) means Part 2 of the Certification for Employee Benefits (Chinese Medicine) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2006 (16 of 2006);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate or medical certificate relates to a period of days or hours if the certificate or medical certificate is produced for the purposes of—

subparagraph.content: an employee taking that period of days as maternity leave under Part III or sickness days under Part VII; or
having that period of hours counted as hours in which an employee has worked by virtue of paragraph 3(2)(a) of the First Schedule.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Application of this Ordinance as amended by the Employment (Amendment) Ordinance 2007

subsection.content: This Ordinance as amended by the Employment (Amendment) Ordinance 2007 (7 of 2007) (amending Ordinance) applies to contracts of employment entered into on or after the date of commencement＊ of the amending Ordinance (commencement date).

subsection.leadIn: Where an employee’s contract of employment was entered into before the commencement date and the date of termination of the contract falls on or after the commencement date, this Ordinance as amended by the amending Ordinance applies to the calculation of the following payments—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any payment in lieu of notice or sum payable by or to the employee under Part II;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any sum payable to the employee under section 15(2);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any sum payable to the employee under section 33(4BA) or (4C);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any sum payable to the employee under section 40A(2);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any sum payable to the employee under section 41D.

subsection.content: Where an employee’s contract of employment was entered into before the commencement date and any end of year payment or proportion thereof payable to the employee under Part IIA becomes due on or after the commencement date, this Ordinance as amended by the amending Ordinance applies to the calculation of the end of year payment or proportion thereof.

Where an employee’s contract of employment was entered into before the commencement date and any maternity leave pay, sickness allowance, holiday pay or annual leave pay is payable by the employer to the employee in respect of a wage period the last day of which falls on or after the commencement date, this Ordinance as amended by the amending Ordinance applies to the calculation of the maternity leave pay, sickness allowance, holiday pay or annual leave pay.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Employment (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2018

subsection.content: A specified provision applies to a claim by an employee for remedies under Part VIA if the material date for the employee falls on or after the specified date for the specified provision.
Subsection (1) applies regardless of whether or not the employee’s contract of employment was entered into before that specified date.
A former provision applies to a claim by an employee for remedies under Part VIA if the material date for the employee falls before the specified date for the former provision.
Subsection (3) applies regardless of whether or not proceedings in respect of the claim have begun before that specified date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former provision (原有條文) means section 32J, 32N, 32O, 43N, 43P or 43R, or any part of the section, as was in force immediately before it was amended by the Employment (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2018 (21 of 2018);

material date (關鍵日期) means—(a)in relation to an employee dismissed in any of the circumstances mentioned in section 32A(1)(a) or (c)—(i)if the employer has notified the employee of the dismissal before it took effect—the date on which the employee was notified; or(ii)in any other case—the date on which the dismissal took effect; or(b)in relation to an employee the terms of whose contract of employment have been varied in the circumstances mentioned in section 32A(1)(b)—(i)if the employer has notified the employee of the variation before it took effect—the date on which the employee was notified; or(ii)in any other case—the date on which the variation took effect;

specified date (指明日期)—(a)in relation to a former provision, means the commencement date* of the provision of the Employment (Amendment) (No. 2) Ordinance 2018 (21 of 2018) that—(i)repeals the former provision; or(ii)amends the former provision to become a specified provision; or(b)in relation to a specified provision, means the commencement date* of the provision of that Ordinance that—(i)adds the specified provision; or(ii)amends a former provision to become the specified provision;
specified provision (指明條文) means section 32J, 32N, 32NA, 32NB, 32O, 32PA, 32PB, 32PC, 43N, 43P or 43R, or any part of the section.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Employment (Amendment) Ordinance 2020
section.content: The transitional provisions contained in Schedule 10 have effect.

tr.td: The provisions of this Schedule are to ascertain whether or not any contract of employment is a “continuous contract” for the purposes of this Ordinance.

In the case of a contract of employment existing at the commencement of this Ordinance, such period of employment next preceding the date of commencement of the Ordinance as may be necessary shall be taken into account in order to ascertain whether or not the contract of employment is a continuous contract.

section.name: s2
section.content: Subject to the following provisions, where at any time an employee has been employed under a contract of employment during the period of 4 or more weeks next preceding such time he shall be deemed to have been in continuous employment during that period.

subsection.content: For the purposes of paragraph 2, no week shall count unless the employee has worked for 18 hours or more in that week, and in determining whether he has worked in any hour the provisions of sub-paragraph (2) shall apply.

subsection.leadIn: If in any hour the employee is, for the whole or part of the hour—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: incapable of work in consequence of sickness or injury; provided that any such incapability in excess of 48 hours is supported by a certificate issued by a registered medical practitioner, registered Chinese medicine practitioner or registered dentist; (Amended 5 of 1995 s. 11; 16 of 2006 s. 10; 5 of 2022 s. 12)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: absent from work due to the employee’s compliance with a Cap. 599 requirement; or (Added 5 of 2022 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: absent from work in circumstances such that, by law, mutual arrangement or the custom of the trade, business or undertaking, he is regarded as continuing in the employment of his employer for any purpose,

subsection.continued: then, save as provided in paragraph 4, that hour shall count as an hour in which he has worked.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: Where an employee is absent from work for the whole or part of any hour—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: because of a strike (which is not illegal) in which he takes part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: because of a lock-out by his employer,

section.continued: that hour shall not count as an hour in which he has worked, but the continuity of his period of employment shall not be treated as broken by any such absence.

section.name: s5
section.content: If a trade, business or undertaking is transferred from one person to another, the period of employment of an employee in the trade, business or undertaking at the time of the transfer shall count as a period of employment with the transferee, and the transfer shall not break the continuity of the period of employment.

section.name: s6
section.content: For the purposes of this Schedule, any reference to hours in which an employee has worked shall mean hours in which he has worked for his employer whether or not the hours were worked under the same or another contract of employment with that employer and whether or not they were consecutive hours. (Replaced 41 of 1990 s. 23)

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: In this Schedule, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: week (星期) means a week ending with Saturday.

schedule.name: sch1A
schedule.heading: Maximum Amount of Maternity Leave Pay for Latter Period of Maternity Leave

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Procedure for Apprehension of Absconding Employer

section.name: s1
section.content: In this Part, the wages and moneys described in section 67(1)(a) and (b) are referred to as the debt. (Amended 32 of 2000 s. 48)

section.name: s2
section.content: An application under section 67 shall be as in Form 1 in Part II.

section.name: s3
section.content: If a District Judge, after making such investigation as he considers necessary in respect of an application made under section 67, is satisfied that there is probable cause for believing that the employer is about to leave Hong Kong with intent to evade payment of the debt, he may issue a warrant as in Form 2 in Part II ordering that the employer be apprehended and brought before a District Judge to show cause why the employer should not be required to give security in accordance with paragraph 5. (Amended 48 of 1984 s. 32)

section.name: s4
section.content: If an employer who is brought before a District Judge in accordance with a warrant issued under paragraph 3 shows cause why he should not be required to give security in accordance with paragraph 5, the warrant shall be discharged and the employer shall be released.

subsection.content: If an employer who is brought before a District Judge in accordance with a warrant issued under paragraph 3 does not show cause why he should not be required to give security in accordance with this paragraph, the District Judge may make an order requiring the employer to enter a bond, in accordance with sub-paragraph (3), for his appearance before a District Judge whenever called upon until he has paid to the employee the full amount of the debt.

If the employer offers, in lieu of entering a bond under sub-paragraph (1), to secure the payment to the employee of the full amount of the debt by any other arrangement, the District Judge may accept such other arrangement as security for the payment to the employee of the full amount of the debt in lieu of the bond.

subsection.leadIn: A bond entered under sub-paragraph (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be in favour of the employee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall be as in Form 3 in Part II;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall be for such sum, not exceeding the amount of the debt, as the District Judge may order; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: shall be a bond with such number of sureties, approved by the District Judge, as the District Judge may order.

section.name: s6
section.content: If an employer complies with an order made under paragraph 5(1), or secures the payment to the employee of the full amount of debt by any other arrangement under paragraph 5(2), the warrant issued under paragraph 3 shall be discharged and the employer shall be released.

section.name: s7
section.content: If an employer fails to comply with an order made under paragraph 5(1), a District Judge may commit him to prison until the order is complied with or until the expiration of 3 months from the date of committal, whichever event occurs first.

subsection.leadIn: On the application of the employer, or of any surety for a bond entered under paragraph 5, a District Judge, if he is satisfied that any of the conditions specified in sub-paragraph (2) have been fulfilled, shall order as may be appropriate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that any warrant issued under paragraph 3 be discharged;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: that any bond entered under paragraph 5 shall be void (notwithstanding the conditions thereof); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that the employer be released from any arrangement made under paragraph 5(2).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in sub-paragraph (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the debt has been satisfied in full or has been abandoned;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: that no proceedings brought to recover the debt or any part of the debt from the employer have been prosecuted diligently;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that all proceedings brought to recover the debt or any part of the debt from the employer have been finally struck out or dismissed.

subsection.content: Any surety for a bond entered under paragraph 5 may at any time apply to a District Judge to be discharged from his obligation under the bond.
On receipt of an application under sub-paragraph (1), the District Judge shall call upon the employer to appear before a District Judge.

On the appearance of the employer before the District Judge, the District Judge shall order the surety by whom the application under sub-paragraph (1) is made to be discharged from his obligation under the bond, and shall order the employer to provide another surety or sureties, approved by the District Judge, for the bond.

If an employer is ordered under sub-paragraph (3) to provide an approved surety or sureties for a bond, the provisions of paragraphs 6 and 7 shall apply as if the order were an order made under paragraph 5(1).

section.name: s10
section.content: No fees shall be payable to the District Court in respect of or in connection with an application made under section 67 or under paragraph 8 or 9.

inline.inline: Application for Warrant for Apprehension of Absconding Employer
